name: Wildwood Park
reviews: Not as 'wild' as the name leads to think but a great time for all ages, mostly hardened trail and seemingly stroller accessible (although not attempted myself). The visitor center is great and informative with plenty to read about the history of the park and the items you wondered about whilst hiking. I'd recommend to keep the visitor center for last.

Great for walks and strollers. There is always wildlife to observe. You can go and have a different experience each time. From the trail you take to the people you run into do the life that you see. There is also some pretty cool natural art.

Great place to enjoy the woods, scene and FRESH AIR for our LUNGS. Lets give the future(young people) a great world to live in. Support your local parks and stop the Gutting and Dismantling of the EPA.  "Mother Nature" gives us love and life, lets love her back and PROTECT HER PEOPLE!!!

This place is amazing for nature. They have a small coloring room for kids. Provide binoculars for the view outside! In case of bad weatherthe inside has a lot to see, in the outside has. I went on a job field trip, but it's definitely family fun!
Our family loves Wildwood park. It's a nice place to take a walk or teach a child to ride a bike. The nature center is amazing for kids, lots of hands on activities.

name: The National Civil War Museum
reviews: Beautiful museum! We spent only a few hours here, but you could easily spend the entire day looking at everything. It will take you back in time. The curators did a great job with the layout, some of it is a bit redundant, but all worth seeing. We went on a Monday when they first opened, it wasn't busy which made the experience more reflective, as you're not trying to hover or read around a crowd, also it was very very quiet and peaceful, which I imagine it would not be on a busy day or if they had a field trip of kids.

They got big guns, they got little guns, they have roughly medium sized guns that are not quite as big as the big guns. It is also important to note that the roughly medium sized guns are not quite as little as the little guns. If the little guns are a 2 and the big guns are a 18, the roughly medium sized guns would be a 9. If you like guns, you might lile this place, no promises.

This is a very nice museum. There are so many interesting artifacts that I was very impressed to see. It is very nicely laid out and you could certainly spend a few hours here learning more about our Nation's history.

Good Learning Experience

I enjoyed my tour of the museum! It was very informative with actual Pre and Post Civil War artifacts! Being a Southern Black American, and seeing the real chains and clothing worn by slaves that could have been my ancestors was a very moving experience. I would have liked to see more exhibits about the contribution made my slaves to the winning of the war.
This is a top notch museum. Not crowded on march 12. We walked through it in about 3 hours.

name: Pennsylvania State Capitol Complex
reviews: Wonderful Capital Building.  We took the free guided tour which takes a little over a half hour, then followed that will the self guided tour and took another 45 minutes.  Guided tours run every half hour.  The building, artwork and furnishings are impressive and in excellent condition.  Especially check out the artwork in the Moravian tile floor.

The tour was quick, we got the House, the Senate and the Supreme Court room.  The building and history are truly amazing and pictures will never do it justice.  Make it a point to visit this exquisite place.
This is the best and pretty good place to come after work to grab some pizza and drinks. I definitely coming back here again. Best of all the best!

I was very impressed by the architect and artwork that went into this Capitol building. It's a good place to meet with your state representatives and to have Rally's to push important bills through. Wonderful offices to  work in, very secure, handicap accessible to all complete with a cafeteria although I would consider the food that was served to be substandard and a better quality needed for our state representatives. I must stop in if you're in the area Harrisburg Pennsylvania

Here's the mega troubling on routes of 119 and 30 interchange is problem on lots of traffic jam on the holidays and some evenings and now coming soon new business is unconstruction now and will be open for summer, it's will be biggest trouble in the traffic jam on location and area!! Here's some succestion for the location now first remove which business now is the time for road work and adding the new road ramps to route 30 interchange now and that's good idea right now!!

name: The State Museum of Pennsylvania
reviews:
Beyond expectations. What a great place to spend a couple of hours, meandering through ancient and recent history.
Everything is covered from dinosaurs to the development of the Penna Turnpike! My 7 year old was captivated throughout the exhibits and really liked the civil war spread.

Recommended!
Went here, and enjoyed every moment. The vastness and variety of the historical pieces here really made me like this place.
Great history and nice place

I love taking my daughters here because there is so much for them to do in the toddler area right in the front of the museum. We haven’t made it out of there except once and my oldest kept asking to go back! It is for kiddos up to 5 and there is so much to do! They have large farm animals including a GIANT baby chick, building blocks, apples that can be “picked” from the trees and carrots and cabbage that can be “harvested.” There is also several costumes for the kids to dress us, tons of books, lots of stuffed animals, a play bedroom with a small kitchen and tunnels, a play bus with a small slide, and they also have toys that they routinely swap out so there is always something different. 

One of my favorite things is there is a bathroom right inside with a kid sized toilet that is perfect for potty training toddles. They do not allow food or drinks inside and are open starting at 10 am.  Another great thing is that it is free for AD military and dependents so that is not only appreciated but also a plus! The perfect hot or rainy day activity.

I’m sure we will be back many times!

We enjoyed Charter Day (free admission!)! It was nice to explore our states history and see the actual charter from the King of England to William Penn allowing him to establish a colony here. The only complaint was the show in the planetarium. It was nothing but a giant ad for NASA and their cries for more funding. But for free...it was something to do.

name: Pennsylvania National Fire Museum
reviews: Great museum filled with fire fighter history. It was a great stop on the way back fro Hershey. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.
As a volunteer firefighter i loved this place. A converted fire station with tons of history! Lots of antiques to see, price was awesome ($7/person)

Very awesome displays, perfect place for any fire department enthusiast or current/past members of the fire service. Members of the museum are themselves retired fire service members and very knowledgeable.

What a wonderful experience! I took my 17yr old son and his 12yr old stepbrother on a Saturday morning - it was not very crowded at all. The staff was polite, well-informed, helpful and attentive.
Originally the Reily Hose Co. No. 10, a Victorian Firehouse built in 1899, this museum exceeded my expectations. The website doesn't do it justice!
The lower level houses apparatus, firefighting equipment and the gift shop. The upper level has the historic Gamewell Alarm System - a fantastic, interactive display from the 1920s - as well as an exquisite collection of firefighting memorabilia. Don't miss the beautiful memorial wall, and remember to visit the gift shop - prices are super reasonable!
Absolutely loved the museum. Lots to look at and learn. They were even nice enough to allow my toddler to sit on the engines. Highly recommend for the fire fighter lover in all of us.

name: Riverfront Park
address: 200 S Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17104, USA
reviews: You can take a walk over the river if you like to. Or just enjoy the sites from this side of view. Overall plenty of action.
Nice park with scenic views of the river. Plenty of places to sit and admire the view. Very difficult to find a place to park nearby though.
Thus is a beautiful site to sit back, relax, and take  in some sunshine
Great place to take a dog
Photos Copyright Freundly Sky's Aerial Imaging LLC

name: Susquehanna Art Museum
reviews: There are essentially four exhibit areas. Very well done. Perfect additional stop if you're headed to Midtown. Take advantage of the free parking in back. I didn't realize it was there until I saw the sign on the front door.

What an amazing place! We are here for the 1st time on a school trip. The morning presentations were divided into to parts for the elementary children (k-2/3-5)& was at a level that was easily understood by them without treating them as if they were unintelligent. My son (7) thoroughly enjoyed the creative actitivty & said he even liked learning about the artist & seeing the other paintings.
My daughter (11) attended the afternoon (6-12) presentation & said that it wasn't as boring as she thought it would be. The also did a creative actitivty which she loved and said the presentation on the pictures was very interesting & informative.
With the muesum changing exhibits every 12 week there are multiple times each year you could visit & do new things. We enjoyed this trip a lot & plan to become members to enjoy it even more. Some of the perks are AWESOME.

My husband and I visited the museum during the Picasso exhibit, and we had a wonderful time! For starters, we had no problem finding regular meter parking on the same block as the museum which made for a very pleasant beginning to our artsy adventure. The museum and exhibition itself was somewhat on the small side but not disappointing in the least. If anything, it helped to create a more intimate, laidback atmosphere. You did not feel the need to rush through the exhibit. It gave off a relaxed vibe , and allowed for you to spend time truly enjoying and discussing each piece. It was a very nice, and much welcomed change from  the hustle and bustle of the larger museums and/or exhibits we have been to. We also were very happy and excited to learn that just a few blocks down from the museum was an absolutely beautiful and wonderful bookstore complete with a delicious coffee bar. From the outside, it was not much to look at, but upon entering, it was indescribable! It was just like the old bookstores you always see on movies. It was the perfect ending to a relaxing and inspirational day! I highly recommend anyone who is a fan of art check out Susquehanna Art Museum via Facebook for more information and their upcoming events!
Small but current collections are diverse and engaging. Kid friendly, inexpensive, and only a couple of blocks from the market.  Would definitely do again.
Very unique place with lots of different mediums used in displays. The staff is very friendly. You don't want to miss going through this museum.

name: Benjamin Olewine III Nature Center
reviews: Great place to go with kids.  Lots of neat exhibits and a bird watching area
Awesome trails. Some right over the water on docks. Great for walking the dog or going for a run. And of course there are all the animals and aquatic life.
We love coming to Wildwood and the Nature Center. There are so many fun things for the kids to explore and find. Bring your walking shoes and get outside!

Great place (Wildwood Park, just north of Harrisburg PA).  We walked the main loop which is about 2.5 miles.  Saw an otter, a couple of great blue herons, a turtle, a coot, some mallards , etc.  They have some fun "natural" art exhibits along the trail.
This was always a wonderful place to take my kids. It was great to revisit that with my grandchild who had an awesomely good time.

name: Cathedral of Saint Patrick
reviews: This is such a beautiful church.  I dont think the regulars are used to visitors because folks weren't overly welcoming,  but that's ok, I still really enjoyed my time with God!

Went to an ordination here and this place is spectacular! Beautiful, elegantly designed and the acoustics are out of this world! Exactly what you want your cathedral to be, and I can't wait to visit again!
Imposing exterior and beautiful interior! Worth a stop-by for those visiting downtown Harrisburg.

As goes for most cathedrals the architecture and interior design, the work of the artist that had a hand with finishing off the inside the decor I have to say outstanding. A wonderful place to check out as well as to Worship in
A beautiful sacred space, blocks from the Capital. I wish I had more time to spend in prayer and exploring here.

name: Negley Park
reviews: My partner and I had the most wonderful experience. A very clean park, I’ve never even heard of this gem until my coworker recommended it to me! It’s so nice to see a skyline view across the susquehanna river of Harrisburg. Highly recommend.
Very relaxing family-friendly beautiful view of Harrisburg over the river
Very nice skyline view of Harrisburg especially during a sunset :)
My kids grew up playing at Negley. That was 27 yrs ago! Loved it then, live it now. Great for all day fun! 👍
Perfect vantage point to watch the sun rise over Harrisburg and the Susquehanna River.

name: Pennsylvania Governor's Residence
address: 2035 N Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17102, USA
reviews: What an amazing opportunity to walk through the PA State governor's have resided. This building is rich in history and has a beautiful garden.
Very cool inside. Well worth a tour.
Marvelous Christmas open house. Staff was so welcoming. The residence is beautiful!

This past Sunday was the first time we visited the Governor's Residence.  On a special occasion of course --  the Annual Holiday Open House!  You see, normally the GR is only open for tours during the months of April, May, June, September, and October between the hours of 9:30 am and 2:00 pm.  I don't think anyone would take a day off from work just to go on the tour, do you?  So this was a golden opportunity that we didn't want to miss.

Now it was for the Christmas holidays so it was even more the reason to visit. There were a total of 8 Christmas trees inside the GR!  Garlands and ornaments were everywhere.  Santa Claus was there for picture taking.  The Christmas village and the 3 trains that were running on the tracks -- so fascinating!   There were free hot ciders, hot chocolate, and cookies.  All of the staff were out greeting people and answering questions. Choir was singing Christmas Carols and the pianist was playing funky tunes.  Governor Wolf and his First Lady, Frances were there shaking hands with visitors and posing for photos.  And most of all, the mansion itself was simply amazing, as ornate as a residence can be!

We were fortunate to be part of this occasion on our first visit. We had such fond memories of the time we spent there.

This is truly a timeless historical landmark that pays homage to the rich tradition of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania's democracy. the campus is well manicured and the staff that keeps it in great condition is truly phenomenal.

name: John Harris-Simon Cameron
address: 219 S Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17104, USA
reviews: Event was a re-enactment of the first public reading of the Declaration Of Independence.  Train, plane and automobile traffic occasionally drowned out the speaking, but the event was well informed, well executed and well oriented.  The tour of the mansion was also well done.  A good way to begin our holiday activities.

The young woman sitting at the desk didn't bother to look up when I entered the building to sign in for the tour, but another woman quickly came up to greet me and was very helpful...and friendly.  The mansion is beautiful and transports you back in time.  The tour was informative and the tour guide had the answers to all our questions.  There were renovations being done to bring the mansion back to a period true state and we can't wait to come back to see how the changes come out.  The free parking was a nice surprise after paying for parking for our other stops in downtown Harrisburg.
This was interesting and it was historical!
Very traditional Arabic restaurant with delicious food
Great history and beautiful home.

name: Reservoir Park
reviews: Very nice park with great city views. We saw the largest red fox walking around on our visit here. It decided to sit down about 50 feet from us off the walking path. It just sat and watched us like we watched it. It could've cared less about us. It was such a neat thing to see.

Some of the best views of Harrisburg are from this park. My favorite time of day to pause here is late afternoon and sunset. There is a one way road that makes a full circuit around the park and 3 entrance/egress.  I will cut through not just to save time, but for the views. An extra 10 seconds at a stop sign, looking across the city I grew up in, always brightens my day.
Reservoir park is a huge park.  It has a giant playground, nice basketball courts and they have great live events.
Nice city park. Great location, nice and sunny with plenty of trees for shade.
A place of calm and quiet amidst a busy city.

name: Harrisburg Sunken Garden
address: 1210 N Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17102, USA
reviews: Nice riverfront park park. Walkways and park are good for relaxation.keen eyes may find some wildlife at the river bank
Unique feature enclosed in a very unique Riverfront Park. The park was created in the early 1900s. The statues are both old and new and the Riverview is always beautiful. The sunsets are beautiful!
Great area to walk especially in the spring and summer. Very spacious for exercise and benches for reading and picnics.
Beautiful place to walk your dog 50 yards away is the Susquehanna River so you can make a loop through the garden down to the river and back up your dog will thank you for it
Awesome place to run through along the river.

name: Fort Hunter Mansion and Park
address: 5300 N Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17110, USA
reviews: Although I live in the area, I haven't visited here before. We came for the Maple Syrup festival but stayed for the nature walks and beautiful scenery. We didn't pay to go into the mansion but walked the grounds and took in the river views. There is a little playground, benches, and picnic tables. The mansion is across the street from the barn and covered bridge, which are also cool.  If you are looking for something free to do outside, this  would be great to bring the kids and walk around, enjoy the day, maybe have a picnic. You could even have a fun adult date here.

This was a delightful place for the holidays. They had displays, tours of the mansion, and crafts. Mainly though my little one loved the model railroad display they had for the holidays. Really a good place for nice walk even when it's not the holidays. They do have events throughout the year, so you will want to check their website.

We went to the mansion on Friday because the kids were off school for Columbus Day. Both of my children went to Fort Hunter for their 3rd grade field trips and my daughter has been asking to go back for over a year! Plus my husband has never been. We walked up and rang the bell and a very friendly tour guide answered and we paid for the tour. It was extraordinary! Despite 3 of the 4 of us having toured the mansion before she provided a great deal of new facts. Even my 11 year old son said it felt like a different tour. She spent almost an hour with us and answered all our questions and was extremely knowledgeable. Unfortunately none of us took note of her name. I would love for Fort Hunter to know she is amazing! Thanks for a fun family day!
Great place to learn history. Beautiful wedding venue! Friendly staff. Neat little gift shop. Nice picnic spot. I highly recommend taking the tour of the house.
The views of the Susquehanna River at this park are always soothing. It's one of my favorite meditation spots!

name: Adams-Ricci Park
address: 100 E Penn Dr, Enola, PA 17025, USA
reviews: A nice, clean park with walking trails, shades, seating arrangements, picnic areas, options to grill. There are many areas for children to play. Tennis courts. I always find sports, events going on here at all time. Parking convenient and available at diff places throughout the park. Good place to walk pets too. Love this park.

This was a fantastic park! Very clean, and well kept. Numerous courts to use: tennis, basketball. Picnic tables readily accessible, trash bins near every table. Full bathrooms open for use. We saw many small playgrounds at various places, and one gigantic super fun play area. Big win for the family on our road trip.
Very awesome park. Lots for kids to do, nice walking paths, nature trails (make sure wear sturdy shoes) that go down to the creek. Great place to walk your dog as well.

Nice clean park. There are multiple different sport fields there. You can play tennis and basketball. They have bathrooms and benches. A lot of parking space. There is a children playground. In addition, there are few trails. There is a bench on the river shore. It is a peaceful place

A nicely kept park. Clean with plenty to do. Railroad car to visit, Tennis courts, soccer fields, long walking trails, multiple playgrounds and pavilions with portable toilets during the off  season. Dogs are welcome on leashes. Ample Parking lot, that's long and close to everything. I highly recommend visiting.

name: Do You Even Escape?
address: 2201 Market St, Camp Hill, PA 17011, USA
reviews:
They had off street parking, and friendly game master. The puzzels themes are fun.

Now for the 3 star rating stuff.

The room felt a little thrown together and cheap. 

In the room my group did, there was a bonus objective, however there was NOT a puzzle on how to complete it. You just had stumble upon it.

I had a fantastic time here with my family in one of the Titanic rooms. It's a very interactive experience, and it takes a lot of different types of brains to escape. The staff is amazing - they test you on how to use different types of locks before you enter the room so that you know what you're doing once you're in there. And they are watching/listening the entire time, so they can offer clues along the way if you get stuck. The rooms are very claustrophobic-friendly, too. We had a window in our room that we could open, and there's a button next to the door that opens it if you need to step out for a minute or use the bathroom. Very fun experience, I would definitely return!

We liked the shipwreck theme and it was challenging without it being too difficult. The person who explained the rules/room spoke very fast and made us feel rushed. The one lock was very difficult to open- we had the correct code and tried it multiple times without it opening. They should have locks that work for an escape room.
Four of us did one of the smaller rooms. We had a blast. We talked with one of the owners for a bit, he is a bit, he was really nice. We look forward to going back and doing the other room some time.

We started here with a group of 10 people for my wife's birthday party. Let's just say we had a blast. Unfortunately, we did not make it out in time but we had such a good time. We want to say thank you for helping us celebrate a wonderful day with all of our friends. We highly recommend them!!!

name: Boyd Big Tree Preserve Conservation Area
address: 401 Fishing Creek Valley Rd, Harrisburg, PA 17112, USA
reviews: The Creek trail is really nice and also the end of the Janie trail. Most of the trails are covered by gravel so it doesn't get too muddy

Wonderful place to spend the day, Hiking! Very Beautiful scenery, with 6-9 different Trails to walk, hike, jog on!! My wife and I hike there various times of year, and always enjoy the different scenery of the Forest!!
Peaceful and serene.. The trails arent too difficult. There are benches to sit on when you get to the pond.

Very quiet.  Like green trail was difficult in parts, but not too difficult.  The views on this trail are nice.  Watch for mud after recent rains.  Some spots were muddy for five or ten feet. Overall, a very peaceful place.

Great mix of trails and that good balance of maintenance with low impact on environment. Many trails so make sure you pay attention to the trail markers and remember the trail names to get out easier. Connects to the Appalachian Trail as well.

name: Walnut Street Bridge
address: E River St, Susquehanna Township, PA 18847, USA
reviews: Neat looking bridge for pedestrians and dogs. The narrow concrete walkway on one side is where most people walk on. The wider area of the bridge is metal and it has small holes where you can see through to the water. Definitely not paws friendly and not for those with fear of height. It has a great view and f the river on either side.
Just enjoyed the scenery and the history of the bridge just adds to it .
I love walking this historic bridge. Steel truss bridges are hard to find. Of course not dealing with cars is a bonus. Great views of Harrisburg and City Island too.

First time visitor on Sunday October 21 2018.  Walked halfway.  Great views.  Very windy.  Actually too much wind so I walked carefully back to safer ground.  Will visit again when visiting Harrisburg.
Love this bridge and cross is often on my bike rides and 5ks

name: Five Senses Gardens
address: Capital Area Greenbelt, Harrisburg, PA 17111, USA
reviews: Beautiful garden, it could use a nice clean up though - quite a bit of trash
Best place to relax and expend time with family.

This is such a sanctuary. I love walking by myself and hooking up with the GreenBelt. Its also a great place to take the kids (I have 3 little ones). Swimming in the summer and the shade it provides make it a great place to picnic.

I found the Five Senses Gardens while researching for a visit to Harrisburg on Google Maps.  Thank you Google Maps, I would be lost in the world without you.  I visited the gardens for the first time on Sunday October 21 2018.  Unfortunately the weather wasn’t the best but it was partly sunny and I had a wonderful time exploring with my cameras.  I was impressed that the crossing from the parking lot to the park and trail is being upgraded.  I posted pictures of this.  There is an island in the middle of the street for people crossing to the park.  It looks like the crossing will have a flashing light.  It will be fun to see the improvements when I visit next year.  The park could be used as a rest stop for travelers on the Greenbelt.  Unfortunately there are no facilities in the park.   The sound of Spring Creek stimulated the hearing sense which is very relaxing.  There are no picnic tables but there are a few benches for you to sit and enjoy.  I would love to come back and visit in the spring.  I’m sure it would be more colorful then.   The park is easy to find right along South 28th Street (Route 441).
So peaceful, just water gurgling and birds chirping. You'd never know it's in the middle of an urbanized area

name: City Island Harrisburg
reviews: I always love coming here because there is so much to do. There's walking paths that circle much of the island and observation areas that overlook the Harrisburg skyline. There's also batting cages, miniature golf, a train, volleyball courts, playground, and concession stands. The Pride of the Susquehanna boat is worth checking out for a quick boat ride or dinner cruise. One of my favorite things is walking the Walnut Street Bridge, a steel truss bridge closed to cars. It connects to Riverfront Park in Harrisburg.

Serene..... Quiet island in the middle of the Susquehanna -or at least off season. Great views of the Harrisburg skyline and surrounding hillsides. Nice walking areas here, mini golf, boat ramp and the Senators! Also take a cruise on the Pride of the Susquehanna May - November
Perfect view from all the decks by the river and cute sightseeing train around.
Beautiful place for the family. Lots to offer. Good food, and nice mini golf. Nice safe place for walking with the family.
Great place to catch a ball game, or play a game of kickball.

name: Market Street Bridge
address: Market St Bridge, Harrisburg, PA 17101, USA
reviews: Amazing sunsets, nice park, great views, walk the bridge, grab a bike, take a train ride, watch a baseball game, have a picnic, putt putt and much more. Awesome place for the family to spend the day.

Early morning walk along the Riverfront Park is something I would recommend. Several bridges can be spotted from the park benches. The Market Street Bridge seems to be the one with markers. Details about the construction of the bridge can be found in front of the bridge near the park pathway.

Visited Harrisburg on Sunday 21 October 2018.  The bridge looks nice from a distance.  Up close it looks like Reading's Penn St. Bridge before its current makeover.  Needs a lot of work.  Don't park your car underneath.

Not sure why a bridge gets a rating but I'll give it 5 stars. This bridge is a BEAST! In the 90's the walnut street bridge collapsed and floated into it. Market street bridge held it's ground! It is also the only driving bridge onto city island.
Access point to the park and side walk. Nice place to fish or play frisbee. Walking with kids is a great activity

name: Market Square
reviews: HARRISBURG.  Pa.  HARRISBURG.   From.   2nd.    And.   Market.   St.    To.   Cameron.     And.   Market.   St.     It.   Reminded.    Me.   Maryland      Baltimore.      1934.
The center of downtown.
Nice, city bus center, hotel center
I go there mainly to catch a bus or an Uber. Nice place to be.
Interesting Harrisburg destination

name: Adventure Park
address: 1775 Lambs Gap Road, Mechanicsburg, PA 17050, USA
reviews:
A wonderful park to bring children of all ages and abilities. There is both an accessible playground for bigger kids as well as one for the younger kiddos.  From tunnels, to slides and balance beams as well as swings, there really is everything! There is even a rock wall. here is also a sandbox.

In addition to the playgrounds, there is a paved walking path that goes around a large grassy field. There are two pavilions with picnic tables and one of them also houses some outdoor exercise equipment. 

In addition to all of this, there is grass volleyball courts, soccer fields, and plenty of space for just about anything. 

You can rent the pavilions for your outdoor gatherings such as birthday parties, etc. there is a pretty well-maintained bathroom facility as well. In at least the women’s, there is a changing table provided. They are closed during the winter months so keep that in mind. There are drinking fountains on the outside of this building as well but they are also shut off during winter months. 

Overall, a wonderful, ENCLOSED park for kiddos to burn off some energy. Even on a wet day, the playground is pretty dry because of the rubber flooring.

Nice and free park for kids. Playground is fenced.  Nice running track around the compound. Bathroom close at sunset. You can  even have parties (I believe you need permission from the church). Good Place 😊

Great park! There's a lot of tiny humans playing so my own tiny human made a lot of friends! People were so nice they lend my tiny human their ball and we end up playing ball kick. lol there's also pavilions for grilling or just for eating food etc. Overall, great experience and great place!

This is attached to a church and offers a neat outdoor fitness area.  There is a huge area for the kids to play in and a pretty long running track.  This area would be great for a picnic on a sunny day and there are plenty of benches along the trail.  Parking is plentiful and there is no cost to visit.  While I was there they had a 5K race going on, but I was still able to enjoy the area.

This is a great place to take your child if they love to climb steps.   There are plenty of different heights to maneuver across and the majority of high places have a tall sturdy railing to prevent falling.  There is tons of parking and it's separate from the vast play area.   Nice amount of swings, monkey bars and activities to tire out the little ones on.

name: SpringGate Vineyard & Brewery
reviews: The staff were friendly and helpful even though the place was packed for Valentine's day.  They ran a nice promotion for buying two bottles of wine.  The prices were reasonable and the wine tasted great!  They had great food trucks out back that made the experience just outstanding.  I definitely plan on coming back.

Great location all year round but summer is the best. From the winery to the beer garden. Food trucks and live music. Wine slushees are good as well and not too badly priced if you get the refillable cup to use. A great community location and great tasting beverages.

Love this winery, good variety of craft beers and wines. Food trucks and music are a huge plus.Out door fire pits and two big indoor areas are nice.Staff very helpful,we enjoy coming here on special events.

I love everything about this winery. The wine variety is fantastic. The staff is always so very knowledgeable. && there is always some kind if food truck. I have been here multiple times and have never left unsatisfied. 👌

We Had a great time at the Vineyards With my boyfriend. The wine was great. However, the ultimate part of our  weekend was the food we ate while there. My boyfriend had the  Cumin coffee robbed steak which was amazing. We also had the Salmon and pickled shrimp which delicious as well. Hats off to chef Tony. We had a great time at the Vineyards,  will be back soon...

name: Indian Echo Caverns
reviews: This place is amazing. Beautiful formations throughout. Really something to look at. The tour guide was awesome. With her quirky way of telling the stories that went along with the history in each area, to her genuine kindness. This place is definitely worth a visit. Many steps to get to the entrance so keep that in mind. Kids of all ages will love it here.

Highly recommend this tour with Daniel! Here was an amazing tour guide,  very animated and informative.  My family truly enjoyed our experience there. If you get a chance,  ask to hear the dirty about the mommy and the giant

I went with family and friends. We absolutely loved it. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Beautiful caverns. Only downside is lots of step to the caverns. So people with disabilities would have a tough time but can obviously overcome the difficulties due to being strong minded and some help. I would definitely recommend this site for every family.
Not as colorful as Crystal Caves but much larger. Great guide service and friendly staff. Be prepared to hike a lot but worth the effort.

This place was amazing! Not crowded, and the temperature in the cave was nice. The tour guide was very nice and was able to explain all of our questions. There was very interesting scenery both inside and outside of the cave. Very beautiful formations. Unfortunately we went during the winter so we were unable to sift for gems and stuff, but you were still allowed to buy bags and take them home to sift yourself. We got to pet different animals as well. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and I have no complaints. I would recommend this to all ages, because the adults, teens and toddlers all enjoyed it quite a bit. Awesome place to visit! Oh, and the gift shop was really cool, and the prices were very cheap.

name: Veterans Park
reviews: We had a graduation/trunk party. Perfect spot. We were able to do some grilling. And we had access to the kitchenette. Plenty of room for the young people and lots of space for physical activity. Great park
Clean and modern! The location is safe and open. There's a smaller children's play area right beside the big kids play space. Baseball field, soccer/football field and basketball courts.

It so kid friendly.  It has two different parts to the play ground.  One side for smaller kids and the other for older. Two baseball fields, basketball court and tennis courts also. Nice Pavilion area. Great for family picnic...

I like this park. There are some things on the bigger play structure that no longer work and/or are broken, which is upsetting, but my son has a great time. There is also a Cornhole/beanbag toss game behind the picnic pavilion, however, the beanbags are missing. My son (2 years old now) loves to run around so I take him to the baseball outfield sometimes when no one is playing baseball (there are two).
My daughter plays softball & I love that my younger child can go play at the playground. It's clean & well maintained.

name: AACA Museum
reviews: Took my grandson and had a great time! Very nostalgic seeing some of the cars I rode in as a child and drove as a young adult. The train room was a big hit with my grandson. Highly recommend a visit!
Fun and informative. Great for a car buff in your life or to learn more about cars and other vehicles since their inception. It's a fun and well worth it time for the entire family.

I've been waiting awhile to visit this museum. I was not disappointed during our visit yesterday. I know zip about cars - I felt the placards next to each vehicle were very informative and made me feel I could walk away with a liiiiittle bit more knowledge about these beautiful objects. Fantastic variety of automobiles that would interest so many.

Wonderful staff full of knowledge! My boys and I really did enjoy ourselves. They especially liked being able to go in some of the busses. We will definitely be going back regularly as the theme and vehicles on display change a couple times a year.

Worth your time!  Wife and I spent almost three hours looking at and reading about the cars, lots of documentation.  We were the last visitors to leave, a few stayed late in the gift shop for us to look around, prices are VERY reasonable!

name: Hersheypark
reviews: The sweetest place on earth. Here fun meets chocolates. Real attractions are Hershey trolley tour, thrilling coaster rides, Hershey garden with hundreds of butterflies from around the world, Zoo america with exotic animals, Milton S Hershey museum experience. Lovely dining restaurants. Kids too enjoyed a lot. Will visit again with kids soon.Ample of parking space. Certainly recommend to others.....

There is some major changes happening this year, including an expanded entrance much closer to convince world, and a new roller coaster for thrill seekers. I will always return here my kids love it. The water park is awesome for a hot summer day. There is a large variety of things to do for every age!

I absolutely love this place. Rides for every age. If you have a ride around the age of 5 and want to introduce roller coasters rides to them that go upside down / speed, look no more. This is a great start. I started with my child at age 4 here and now she's 9. My daughter loves roller coaster rides and becoming a thrill seeker.

I had the best time ever at Hersheypark. Its Christmas lights alone are worth the trip.  It was an awesome experience to ride the train through the lights. The new Chocolate World is very fun and it has some free attractions. I will definitely come back. Tip: if you come after 6:30 p.m. you can reuse the same ticket next day (but you need to ask for).

Hershey park has been a staple for central Pennsylvania. The park goes through phases of stagnant rides or outdated attractions but continues to update and keep people coming back. They have an abundance of rollercoasters and have added more sensory experiences. The park normally struggles with cleanliness so bring whatever you might need. Make sure you bring cash or was to get lockers or have someone watching all personal items. It can be an ideal location for opportunistic thieves but I have not personally had an issue. Food courts are crammed and can be a tedious task. The park used to have many food locations that made buying food seem less and much variety. Now there is one main hub that Continues to disappoint and and drain the pockets. Security is decent and they take it serious. Local law enforcement has many contingency plans in regards to park safety. Overall a great experience but with slow updates and conscience lacking the park definitely draws return visits less frequent.

name: Friends of Wildwood Lake Nature Center, Inc.
reviews: Nice place to vist and to take walk or run with family and friends it's free
Love this place! So many beautiful things to see. It is so peaceful and relaxing there!
People go there, because they have nothing better to do with themselves...
Good place to walk and enjoy family.
Very peaceful,  clean.

name: ZooAmerica
reviews: The staff take very good care of the animals. They are healthy and their environments are clean. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. They always take time to answer questions. They also have a program that works with your phone to show you educational videos. It is a fun, family place to be.

A good selection of animals to see for a little local Zoo. Especially being attached to a amusement park. The Zoo staff is very nice and do nice educational learnings at certain days and times during the week for kids. My daughters love to go there. Like normal Zoos there are some exhibits that make it hard to see the animals. The mountain lion enclosure especially is very hard, especially for kids. We have been there probably 15-20 times and have never seen but maybe a couple legs or tails ha gong out somewhere.

Great little zoo. We went in November. Not crowded at all. Enjoyed seeing the bears, owls, wolves and the animals in the southwest exhibit (roadrunner was super cool). Perfect place to take a small child who has sensory issues. Was not overwhelming for him. We will definitely visit again.
Nice outing for younger children on a late winter day.  Good tie in to a park or Chocolate World visit.  Not a vast array of animals, but enough to entertain a 2 year old.

I appreciated the fact that apparently not many wild animals are inhabitants of North America, IF the zoo is an accurate depiction of this. Don't set aside a whole day to visit this zoo, it's more of an hour long visit.  Most action can be seen on a cool, cloudy, even rainy day: the bears might be active, you might see some action in the deer pen but overall there is not a ton to see, if you're used to the 'big' zoos. We, as in my family, hit the zoo often early in the morning, right at opening and are, many times, the only visitors. Walk around for an hour, enjoy the reptiles, desert, bears, otters, snowy owls, wolves and go back home.

The park is clean and well maintained as a part of Hershey Park. If you have the Hershey Park food plan or drink cup, you can fill it up in the zoo also.

name: Hershey's Chocolate World
address: 101 Chocolate World Way, Hershey, PA 17033, USA
reviews: Hershey’s chocolate world is one of the most joyous experiences I’ve ever had. Chocolate is my favorite food, so this is like heaven. The best part was create your own candy bar, where, as the name suggests, you make a chocolate bar. The gift shop also has tons of cool trinkets that you can’t find anywhere else, such as Hershey themed legos, dolls, and toy cars. All in all, the whole place is really great.

Fun stop to add to the travel books, great for adults and kids! Take a ride in a chocolate themed ride that bring you through a visually engaging guided tour of their chocolate factory inner workings. They have other interactive options like creating your own chocolate bar and plenty of different chocolate creations to purchase.

We got there at opening on a Monday, and still ended up waiting an hour to see the 4D movie. Don’t bother with the movie, it was less movie, way too much audience participation, the story was horrible, not sure I agree with the message they were sending, and the effects under the seat hurt. The free tour was great, because we were there so early, we just walked right on, and I thought it was very fun and informative. We also did the make your own chocolate bar experience. Worth it. You get to customize a chocolate bar, and the packaging. You get to watch it be made, and have a fun souvenir to take home! Don’t bother with the candy in the gift shop, they don’t have anything you can’t get at your neighborhood Walmart or target for much cheaper (and I’m from the west coast), but otherwise a very fun gift shop. My friend had the new hot chocolate that is advertised as having a full melted chocolate bar in it. It doesn’t. Just a boat load of syrup. I also had the chocolate strawberries, they were great, and reasonably priced I thought.

Interesting enough. The chocolate tour was short and sweet (pun intended) and free, so can’t really complain. The other experiences were kinda pricey, but if you have kids I think its worth a try. Also, very clean.

Awesome place with a HUGE assortment of flavors of chocolate and other sweets that you can only buy on the East Coast. Fun, festive and colorful place! As you walk in, you are hit with the typical Hershey chocolate mouth that will immediately get you salivating. Pretty fair prices and amazing staff. 
Love the free tour and ride from the parking lot to the main attraction.

name: Hershey Gardens
reviews: Beautiful garden with many different botanical species and new type of indoor and out door plants and flowers. Many beautiful different type of colorful butterflies. Very professional, courteous and friendly staff who greets visitors with smiles. It is such nice and wonderful place in Hershey.

One can easily spend a couple hours here. The butterfly room is amazing! Volunteer staff seem to really know their plants and Hershey history. Well priced and kid friendly. Every season has something different to offer.

Butterfly atrium is very nice. Christmas trees inside building were very nice as well. Grounds were spacious outside with many beautiful and mature trees. I will come back in the spring to enjoy the flowers outside.

Very beautiful and well tended rose garden. There are also many other sub gardens included in this vast garden. This could take an entire day to see and smell and experience all that is here. We will definitely need another trip here. Extremely breathtaking!

We visited today as part of the Hershey Park Season Pass add on plan. None of the staff had ever heard of such a plan but honored it anyway. The weather was cold and rainy so we stuck to the Butterfly Garden and the Christmas tree show case. How fun!

The staff were super friendly and very children oriented explaining things about the butterflies left and right. Showing the scorpions and other bugs in a very educational manner.  

We can't wait to go back to see the rest of the gardens when the weather warms up!

name: Toys On The Square
address: 22 E Main St, Hummelstown, PA 17036, USA
reviews: Such a cool store. We are in town from Cleveland and saw an add for this place so we had to check it out. They have everything in here for all ages. If you are in town or driving by, I’d highly recommend stopping in.

Absolutely love this place! The selection they have is impressive and prices have always seemed reasonable. Lots of different toys for all ages, a lot that I haven't seen anywhere else. Anytime I go in I always end up wandering around for like an hour just looking at all the cool stuff. Highly recommend!
Very diverse selection of toys here. The best die cast car selection I've seen so far. Really great place to bring the kids.
WoW amazing... needs multiple visits to successfully see everything!!

Parking on street. Well maintained restrooms and clean store. Waaaay friendly staff. And great off the wall selection of toys.

As is almost always the case with my reviews parking hurts this business. Other than that support this place. Go in, play with the stuff, and buy something fer yourself, your kid, or even to donate. It will make you feel pretty damn good.

name: Kohl Memorial Park
reviews: Nice, large park. People are always around when the weather is nice with large groups playing baseball, cricket, or volleyball. Dog park is fine. Large enough but not maintained real well. They rely on the community to take care of it. They refill bags and provide chairs which is nice.
Love this place just because my fur baby can have fun in the dog park

Nice dog park. Both small & large dog areas, plus adjacent baseball fields and playgrounds. 
Well kept & friendly atmosphere.
This park is one of the top parks that I have ever been to. I definitely would recommend this park for this area!.

Great spot to hang out with your dog and let him hang out with his doggo friends. Nicely maintained dog play areas with chairs for the hoomans to sitting socialize with the other owners. The park is really well maintained and equipped. Softball field, tennis courts, picnic areas and restrooms are also available.

name: Lake Tobias Wildlife Park
reviews: Good one for family with kids. Don't miss the ride located  at the back. You get to see almost all animals in this small park. Kids would love feeding the pet animals inside their cages. Good Park and it's worth Visiting.

My family has enjoyed many trips to this amazing wildlife center. The animals are well cared for. The educational center is amazing and teaches everyone to respect animals. The best part is the Safari tour and seeing the beautiful animals up close.
The kids had a blast!! Just enough walking that it doesn't tire out the kids. Loads of fun. We loved feeding the giraffes!
My son and i love this place! Highly recommend for any age. We go atleast 5 or 6 times a year and always put a smile on my sons face

A very nice "travel at your own pace" affordable zoo! I love that you can get so up close and personal. You're even allowed to bring in your own food and drinks which is almost unheard of anymore but helps families on a budget who still want to get out. We ate there this time though and the food was reasonably priced for a zoo and yummy.

name: Escape Room
address: 253 W Chocolate Ave, Hershey, PA 17033, USA
reviews: Took my work group here.  We raced in two groups between two rooms.  Everyone had a great time.  My first experience doing an escape room and I really enjoyed it.  Would recommend for families as well.  Problem solving for all ages.  Encourages thinking outside the box and working together.  The Mill is close by if your looking for a nice dinner after!

Second time we have done an escape room and it was just as much fun. They change the rooms - we did a magician / harry potter themed one previously and this time roaring 20s. The person running it / giving tips was lovely and helpful. We made it out with seconds to spare!

What an annoying experience.  First time there with our work group and got stuck with a couple who brought a young kid.  First you need to have a age bracket and second the parents should have known better.  The woman took over.  Definitely not the way I wanted to spend an hour of my time!

Not exactly an escape room because you don't have to escape. I'd call it a mystery room because you need to solve a mystery to win. Or a puzzle room or a lock room, but not an escape room. Overall it was a fun time with my work team and we all agree we'd go again!
Loads of fun! Took my 12-year-old and her friends and they had a blast. (So did I.)

name: The Hershey Story Museum
address: 63 W Chocolate Ave, Hershey, PA 17033, USA
reviews: First class museum! Wonderful staff who were all so friendly in all areas of the museum. Enjoyed a flight of hot chocolate which were delicious. Also got to make truffles which was fun and delicious, and the teachers were very friendly and informative, making the class a great experience. You get wooden chip which activate different kiosks throughout the museum, personalizing your experience. Would plan on at least a half day if not a full day to see it all if you're a slow mover who likes to read everything like my wife and I do. All in all we loved our visit here and would highly recommend!

This Museum is a great history of the Hershey company and of the life of Milton Hershey. We spent 1.5 to 2 hours wandering through all the exhibits, reading, watching and learning. We enjoyed the interactive displays. We only purchased the Basic Museum experience. The building is clean and well kept. The workers were fun and knowledgeable. They made the experience much better for us all.

Not a place you need to go to often but a very informative and well delivered history of Hershey and his chocolate. The cashier will hand over a coin which provides the interactive part of the tour. You activate the coin and put in your information. Then you enter the museum via a long and luxurious stairwell (or elevator) and you'll be supplied with a scavenger hunt paper which leads you through the story and ensures you don't miss a thing.
Expect to be educated about the life and times of Milton Hershey, his machines, extravagant purchases, including a beautiful chandelier and a Titanic ticket and his establishing of the town of Hershey.

Well done Hershey Entertainment!

A Real nice... We didn't have time to finish the entire tour; so we will go back again.  I love that we could go at our own pace.  
Oh yeah, you have to try the chocolate covered bacon .... Yummy

This very much was an enjoyable and enlightening experience. Such an interesting and inspiring story that is told about Milton.  Very engaging with some pretty high tech exhibits that will inform you of just about every aspect of the Hershey experience. Definitely worth a visit the next time you stop at Hershey!

name: Let's Pretend
address: 320 W Main St, Middletown, PA 17057, USA
reviews: This place is definitely worth a try for any child.   There are a variety of small themed rooms to play and interact in that will hopefully touch your child's imagination.   We took our 2 year old and he had a blast even though a few themes were geared for children above his age.   I feel this is an excellent alternative to a playground when the weather isn't cooperating or just to mix things up.   There is a price point per person, so you lose value if 2 adults bring 1 child.

Idea has potential but this location fell short in execution IMO. Additionally, there are signs EVERYWHERE telling parents and kids what not to do. I attached a small sampling of them.

If your business caters to kids under 6 or so, they may not know that the groceries cannot possibly 'make sense' to be in the postal office. And if they do, who cares?! Well, the proprietor of this location thinks very differently.

For $7/ea (parents must pay too), it's an expensive place to play with donated toys that are limited to their pre-designed spots only.

Also noticed prices going up soon. It will be $10 each over two hours. Not that you'll stay that long to begin with...

Super cute idea! Loved that I could let the kids run around and be as little or as much involved as I wanted. I will say that maybe some music would be nice, theres a stereo system that isn't used except to alert the time left for the party. Overall lots of fun though.
This was so much fun for my daughter. She didn’t want to leave. I wish there was a membership but otherwise it was awesome.
Great place for younger children to explore and pretend.

name: Doll House Museum
reviews: This place is the coolest. Each room is it's own exhibit, carefully curated and crafted by the owner and her family to fit a specific theme. It's a must see if you enjoy kitsch and slightly spooky things. Also, the owner is a really nice lady who is happy to answer your questions.
Owner, Suzy, is very nice and accommodating  !!
I love visiting niche attractions, and this is definitely one!
Great museum! Must see.  Brought my 2 year old niece and she loved it.  Spent over an hour, plenty to look at.  Awesome train set too! Check it out
Not only is it a doll museum they do Tailoring there, they do clothes excellent and the prices are marvelous

name: Appalachian Trail - Hawk Rock Overlook
reviews: I don't know how everyone else arrived at this Sherman's Creek Rd location but it is private property. There is a single lane dirt road that passes by many homes with Private Property" signs on there structures... Beautiful area though.

Awesome view on the top. There are interesting places on the trail itself.it is not long or difficult . Easy to follow. There are some stone stairs in one spot. However, it almost continuously goes up . It is a good cardio exercise . My heart rate was 140 bpm. at times.

Great place. The trail is rocky and narrow so you sometimes have to stop to let others pass. The steps are at times twice the height of a normal step, so I would suggest using a walking stick. The stick/cane will help go up and also help to slow your speed on the way down.
Take a binocular if you have one. Yesterday Thursday Feb 20,2020 around 5 pm I saw a pair of bald eagles flying in the distance beyond Hawk's Rock. This was a treat and a lucky sighting. This is the 1st time I'm seen Bald Eagles here coming here for over 3 years. 
Be sure to take water with you, because the the steps will drain your energy and calories on the way up.

My wife and I enjoyed hiking to Hawk Rock overlook this week.  The hike itself and the view at the top are totally worth it!  The trail is easy to follow and maintained very well; however, you do gain a lot of elevation, so the hike is moderately strenuous. There are many stone steps built into the mountain to help your climb.  Most of the hike is along a portion of the Appalachian Trail. We found the trail head easy to find - there's a huge sign that you can't miss. Would do this again for the opportunity to sit at the top, enjoy the breeze, and see the surrounding countryside!
The place has a nice overlook, can be grounded so get there early. Lots of steps over 12 inches high.

name: Adventure Sports In Hershey
reviews: There were not many people here so we almost had the place to ourselves. We had so much fun. We passed by and seen the sign and decided to stop in. So glad we did. We will be back once the weather gets better.
Weather was beautiful. No lines, no wait. Had a wonderful time with my grandson this morning!
Loved it! And affordable prices
Great clean fun for the whole family! Very clean and staff was very friendly and professional!! Very fun place!
Its really a nice place for family to play games

name: The Butterfly Atrium at Hershey Gardens
reviews: Loved visiting here with my family.  My girls enjoyed seeing all the beautiful butterflies.  It was very relaxing and we would definitely come again.  We have visited a different butterfly place that had given out something like cotton swabs with nectar on it and my girls did say they wish they had that here.  Otherwise a wonderful experience.

We love visiting The Butterfly Atrium in Hershey, Pa! There were over 50+ different, beautiful, butterfly species and magnificent plant life. We took many photos and were lucky enough to have two butterflies land on us! We also learned how the cocoa beans are harvested, which was extremely interesting.  We plan to go back this spring to visit the gardens outside.🦋
Tons of butterflies from different regions. The man working was very informative. We learned a lot today and had a great time viewing all the butterfly’s. 🦋🐛

The different varieties of butterflies are absolutely gorgeous! The employees are very nice. It’s VERY humid inside so make sure that if you have a coat, hang it up because you don’t want to be wearing it once you step inside.

This was my first time here. We had a small picnic outside of the grounds where there were tables (no grills though).

There are public bathrooms and a small gift shop. There are WAY more plants and butterflies than my camera (phone) would have room for and the family would have time for.

There is a room where you are surrounded by butterflies and this was what we did after walking the grounds and seeing various displays.

I am NOT one that knows a whole lot about the different kinds of plants...but I like seeing God's creation! And the pics never do justice as compared to the reality.

It did cost $40.50 for my wife/daughter/myself to gain entry to the grounds...but they truly enjoyed their time!

More than a few times some of the flying butterflies would land on people. Really cool for the kids!

😇😎

name: White Rocks Trail
address: 1387 Kuhn Rd, Boiling Springs, PA 17007, USA
reviews: Different terrains, good hiking, beautiful views on high rocks! Brought my teen girls for a nice hike and it had some challenging areas that mad eit interesting.  Came across a snake hidden inside crack of rocks when looking out at the views...immediately made escape so no introductions were made. 😊
Climbing on the rocks while hiking is beautiful and cool. It can be a bit if a challenging to climbed but so much fun. Good trail to takes your dogs on, mine loved it. I can't wait to go again.

Very nicely marked trail. Beautiful scenery. Unfortunately some people can't follow rules. Evidence of people making fires which is not allowed. Broken beer bottles in 1 small area. But overall a great place to hike. It has a good climb. The path is very rocky and uneven so wear shoes to accommodate.

A fairly short and relatively intense out and back hike. It took me with a dog about an hour each way. -It is extremely rocky, from small, almost gravel stones, to ankle twisting mind fields, to scrambling boulders. 
- the only steep section is getting up to the ridge, the ridge itself, though rocky is fairly level with some good scrambling.
This trail is so much fun! I have totally different experiences every time I revisit it.

name: U.S. Army Heritage and Education Center
reviews: This is an amazing museum! The grounds themselves are so awesome! They've got tracked vehicles, artillery pieces, replicas of old Army buildings/barracks, and even a trench! My favorite was the pill box, that was pretty eye opening. Inside you have a ridiculously detailed museum, truly incredible. Great place for vets, history buffs and civies alike.

We just did the outdoor trail and most of the buildings were locked.  Not sure why, I think they were getting ready for some event.  It was an interesting place and a nice walk.  The Trench exhibit was quite interesting.  It just would have been better if we had been able to get inside some of the exhibits.

A wonderful place to visit with family of all ages. The interactive displays were enjoyed by all. Very educational and the trail is a nice walk with beautifully displayed military hardware! An excellent place to visit, explore and learn about our great Army!
As a Iraq war vet, it was nice to tour this place!  I'm huge into military history and this was great!  I will be coming back for sure, I really enjoyed it!
I am Glad I found this Place! Lots of History and terrific Displays! I recommend the walking trails out back with the different military objects.

name: Cullari Vineyards & Winerys
address: 1251 E Chocolate Ave, Hershey, PA 17033, USA
reviews: I’ve known about Cullari for a while as they’re on of my mom’s favorite wineries, but I had yet to venture to their tasting room. The tasting was not rushed, completely reasonably priced, and you keep the glass for no extra charge. The staff was friendly and knew a lot about the wines. It was the only tasting that we have been to where we were able to sit down, have snacks, and actually enjoy the wines without being rushed to the next taste. The two women working the shop when we went were great, and we stayed much longer than anticipated because we just enjoyed their company so much. My wife bought a bottle of the Pink Orchid, but we easily could have purchased a bottle of each.

We visited on Sunday 2/10 and enjoyed great wine served by a very friendly and knowledgeable hostess! Cocoa Nostra wine was pleasantly delicious. Also took a bottle home of the old world red, great table wine. Cute and cozy atmosphere.
Very friendly. Wine was great. Nice variety clerk was entertaining ❤️
Wonderful experience. The gentleman was so helpful and fun to talk with. The ambiance is very nice and comfortable. A nice place to sit and relax with a wine tasting.

Jenna and Larry made this visit a great one for me. Very personable and knowledgeable when it comes to wine and food/snack pairing. The wines are great and reasonably priced. Coco Nostro is my favorite. Pinot Noir and Sweet Chambourcin were smooth and fruity!

name: Fort Hunter Mansion & Park
address: 100 Fort Hunter Rd, Harrisburg, PA 17110, USA
reviews: Really nice Park and clean restrooms
Beautiful park.
Cool place to visit
One of the best music festivals Harrisburg had ever had! Vanessa Collier was amazing!
Awesome!

name: Cocoa Castle
reviews: Kids love this place.  Not enough shade. Benches get extremely hot.

If you visit Hershey park this park Is worth looking up.  It is a huge well kept park and tons of play equipment for the kids.  And room for the parents to relax and watch over the kids while the kids run off some energy !!  Check it out.  Plenty of parking too!

Our grandsons, ages 4 and 10, both loved this park. A lot of structures to climb - ladders, steps and ramps - slides and other tactile activities along with swings and room to just run. This is a Derry Twp. (Hershey, PA) park and is well maintained.
A lot of cool playground equipment I've never seen in other playgrounds. There is good parking to be had and you can walk from here to a lot of places in town.
Very clean safe and tons of playground activities! Tons of swings as well!

name: Gifford Pinchot State Park
reviews: Love going here; it's like our second home! When you have an awesomely trained dog, this place gives you so much freedom to just explore! Sadie and I have our favorite rock that we love to sit on and listen to the water. So relaxing! Great off-leash space ❤️

Trails? What trails? These should be referred to as streams and bogs with the occasional dry section. I have been here in every season and there's never a full trail. With so little distance you'd think boardwalks would be feasible. The appalachian trail is better maintained by VOLUNTEERS.

I love taking my children to pinchot! Or alone to explore the beautiful trails.
Pinchot is also a great place for birthday parties!! Lakeside cookout with playground , sandpit & swimming during summer months. 
I do wish the nature learning center was still open or they’d have educational programs for children.
I’ve never camped here so I can’t rate the campgrounds.

Amazing state park! Hiking, biking, swimming, picnicking, paddling, hunting, camping...even frisbee golf! Great beach on the lake, concessions, and a huge ammount of parking. I can't remember a prettier place to spend a day.
Lovely local park with swimming, boating, fishing and a great frisbee golf course. The snack bar has good Philly cheese streaks. We'll worth a day, or a weekend. They have cabins.

name: Pennsylvania Farm Show Complex & Expo Center
address: 2300 N Cameron St, Harrisburg, PA 17110, USA
reviews: As usual, events held at the Farm Show Complex are well organized. This year, I have been to the Farm Show and now the Harrisburg Auto Show. Plenty of parking is available, though on well attended events off-site parking is added with shuttle service. Today I was able to park next to the complex. The complex has restrooms and food stands through out the building. Parking charges are high at times, but the proceeds go to PA agriculture funds and outreach. Definitely a place to attend an event of your liking.

Pennsylvania's finest farm show.  I highly recommend going and enjoying one of PA staple shows.  Amazing people and food. Animals are always gentle and safe for kids of all ages. Lots of history behind this once a year venue.

I highly recommend being there when they open.  Plenty of parking across the street,  you'll also beat the crowds and enjoy the animals the best.  When early lunch comes, the food court will be still manageable and plenty room to sit or stand.

Enjoy...

I definitely recommend wearing comfortable shoes - there is so much to see! Love seeing all the farm animals. You get an appreciation for all the work that goes into farming. Make sure to stop and watch some demonstrations and presentations at the stages and arenas. The more time you allow the better.

Very good got there this morning 45 minutes before it opened 9 it open we got in. No problem at all walked around But as time goes by the vendors change. different ones that was a lot of AR aftermarket accessories there a whole lot.... Ammunition and shell prices we're in line some of the quantity discounts were pretty good.. I thought the food was just a little high but that's vendors I understand and not they are open everyday like McDonald's to got to make it in three day five days ...

Great location for any size trade show or expo. Easy access parking and plenty of local hotels and restaurants to choose from. Access to I-81 is super easy. Definitely a venue to come back to and one that you would hope to be used for your next event or show.

name: Rockville Bridge
address: 800 S Main St, Marysville, PA 17053, USA
reviews: Beautiful scenery here. I enjoy seeing trains crossing this old bridge!

Built in 1902, to accommodate 4 tracks, it is the third bridge to be built at this location.  As pointed out, it is the longest continuous stone arch bridge in the world.  Just missed a N&S freight crossing to the west side.
Over 100 trains a day and over a hundred years old.

An amazing experience, as it is heaven for the train fan. The bridge gets hundreds of trains every week, with high rates of traffic. This is probably best watched from Bridgeview Bed & Breakfast, made specifically for the trainwatching purpose. I give this a five-star, as it is AMAZING!
Great views for amateur and professional photographers alike.

name: Oakes Museum of Natural History
address: 1 College Avenue Messiah College, Mechanicsburg, PA 17055, USA
reviews: This is an impressive museum for the small space. My favorite section is the one with the full-sized elephant and giraffe, but my 3 year old loves the skunk! It's a must-see during homecoming when students offer crafts, storytimes, and tours of the prep room with snake holding. Could spend an hour in the little kids room with microscopes, books, and crafts. (Full disclosure: proud Messiah College alum here.)
Great little local museum. Loved the cards at each display identifying the animals. Nice place for younger childer to learn.
Fun place to visit with my son's 5th grade class. The animals were amazing !
Very well laid out and informative.  Nice saturday afternoon!!
Awesome experience and awesome prices in gift shop. Fun outing for the family.

name: Miniature Statue of Liberty
reviews: A great trip if you have experience kayaking and can navigate through some rapids. Kind of tough to observe and get a pic of the statue up close unless you land and get out due to the very rapid water and lots of rocks which make up this part of the river. If you go, go with a group.
Its beautiful but there's no place to park your car and admire it

Very fun section of the Susquehanna for whitewater kayaking. You can access this area from downstream on the west shore near Marysville. It's a short paddle upstream where you can spend all day playing in eddies and surfing some waves. Then paddle back down to the takeout. The sunset from here is spectacular.
Very impressive statue in the midst of a gorgeous river!
It was hard to take pictures.  No off the road parking! Still made it fun to do!

name: Fort Hunter Conservancy
address: 480 Camp Reiley Rd, Harrisburg, PA 17112, USA
reviews: Nice park / trail system. As a somewhat experienced hiker, I will say the paths weren't marked clearly, but that wasnt a huge problem. There was a lot of overgrowth, and fallen trees. Still a fun time, great rewarding Vista and super fun hike / rock scramble.

Pros: maybe the best view in the Harrisburg area- with a swing on the power line at the very top!(and a boat too but hey whatever you think you need)
Cons: getting to the top is horribly marked and overgrown. Because much of it is below power lines  the trail is full of loose stones and it’s very easy to lose your footing and fall into the thorny brush because it is not well maintained.
This was a mildly hard hike, that makes you want to stop and go back, but then you keep going. The peek is gorgeous and I would 100percent go again.
Awesome hiden gem in the Harrisburg area. Great views. However, the trail is not well maintained and get really overgrown during the summer months.
When you get to the top of the hill under the powerline,  this is one of the best views in Harrisburg

name: The Centennial Barn
address: 5300 N Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17110, USA
reviews: Always an education and the staff is knowledgeable and friendly
Nice historical building in Fort Hunter park
Good food and service!
Never been here before!
very nice place to visit

name: Turkey Hill Experience
reviews:
Had a great time at the ice cream taste lab. Spend the extra money to include this in your ticket as it’s both fun to create your own ice cream and rewarding to eat a pint of your own creation. Both kids and adults were enjoying it. 

The experience upstairs was cute, but mostly designed for kids. Happy we had a chance to see it and taste some of the label’s current flavours. We had fun designing packaging for our ice cream flavour.

Very cute experience with my 5 year old.  We explored the place for 4 hours and did the ice cream making class.  The plain ice cream they gave was amazing.  But it was fun to add in the toppings.   The class was informative as well.  Afterwards, we explored the play area, free ice tea area, awesome slide, free popcorn and more free ice cream.  

The five year old didn’t want to leave but we eventually did to go eat a late lunch.  

I’d recommend to a friend with kids 4-10.

It was a fun afternoon to spend with friends on a rainy day. 
We enjoyed the museum, but were surprised to find how child-focused it was. There's nothing wrong with that, but it wasn't quite what we expected. 
We participated in the tasting lab to create our own ice cream flavor which we enjoyed a lot. Tour samples are generous.

Such a fun place.  Visited on our way down from Hershey and so glad we got to visitl!  Loved everything about this place.  We particularly enjoyed recording TV commercials and tasting free samples (ice cream and drinks).  It's great for all ages.  Highly recommended!  Easy parking, friendly staff, and clean space.

What an amazing place! Brought my family kids ages 1-4 and they had a blast. We were there over 4 hours having fun. Unlimited ice cream tasting and unlimited lemonade and tea tasting for free no additional package needed. Staff great

name: Hershey Triple Tower
reviews: Very thrilling! My son and I had never been on a tower of this magnitude and really had no idea what to expect! We went on the Reese's tower, in the middle. This tower is very thrilling, you are not even expecting moving and wham, you are launched super fast to the top of the tower, fly out of your seat and before you can comprehend what is happening you go back down a short way. On the way back up the second time, my son had his head in the direction of the over-shoulder harness, and when we made it to the top and got the air time, he got a bloody nose from smashing his head into the harness. He still loved it though, it was a bit too intense for me though. Great fun anyways, and a must experience thrill!

Drop in on the thrills and fun at Hershey Triple Tower, the first choose-your-thrill triple tower in the United States. 

Hershey's Tower 
Standing at 189 feet high, our tallest drop tower features two gravity-defying experiences, SPACE SHOT & TURBO DROP, which rockets riders to the top before blasting back to the bottom at 45 miles per hour! 

Reese's Tower 
Standing at 131 feet high, kick it up a notch with two thrilling cycles of positive and negative G forces on our second tallest drop tower! 

Hershey's Kisses Tower 
Standing at 80 feet high, warm up with two exhilarating cycles of positive and negative G forces on our thrilling drop tower!

A nice little piece of the overall park. A themed triple set of the same ride that offers three levels of "challenge" to anyone who's up for it. Visually the whole set up is pretty striking as well. Kudos to whoever came up with the idea.
Pretty long lines today, but it's a holiday weekend and kinda expected. Great weather for a trip to Hershey!
Fun but not worth the wait! Line times were incorrectly posted. Only one tower open and empty seats on every ride.

name: Little Buffalo State Park
address: 1579 State Park Rd, Newport, PA 17074, USA
reviews: I love this place. Great place to take the whole family for a day retreat. Has a nice pool and one for the kiddos, as well. There is a big long lake that you can rent kayaks or two person paddle boats to row on. There is also a food stand at the pool area. The scenery is also amazing. It's in the mountains. Highly recommend. Prices are decent, too.

My kids love the pool. We live almost an hour away and are driving up at least every other weekend when it's open. 
We'd pack up lunch and enough snacks to last the day. Sometimes a small dinner. There's plenty of grills and space to sit down and picnic.

Beautiful place to walk, fish boat or just sit and look out over the beautiful lake. My family appreciates the staff and all their hard work at keeping it that way. Big plus there are always things to do at the lake. Arts festival, apple harvest, and several opportunities to explore nature and the creatures and their habitat hosted by the Rangers. My family loves Little Buffalo State Park
Took my grandson for a homeschool day seminar on mammals. Very informative and fun. Great job!

Went in January and hiked around the lake through the woods.  Saw around 50 ducks,  in the middle of the lakes, divers from up North.  
Lots of facilities mostly closed for winter.  Looks like a great place for family camping and outings in the summer.

name: Cousler Park
reviews:
This park is beautiful and well kept. There are endless opportunities for enjoyment. There are several types of game courts, fields, a walking path, a bouldering rock, older kids' and younger kids' playground. Parking is abundant.

One uncommon thing I enjoy is all of the memorial plaques. It always reminds me to be grateful for everyone I love and all of the family. 

Lots of other friendly dogs walking here too.

Awesome park! Great area for littles especially with a small misting sprinkler system in the warmer months. Huge layout with several different areas including a large pond and stage for events. Clean to boot. Great family place !

We have always loved this park, my mom always took us here when I was young and we walked the trails and feed the geese. Recently I took my kids here for the Halloween festival they through and they had so much fun. The park is nice for kids of all ages, the pond is beautiful to see and all the geese around it in warmer months. Also a good place to go hunting for painted rocks that people make and leave around for you to find and rehide or hide your own, an activity my daughter and I do.
