Best park in the area for littles, especially on hot summer days. The little sprinkler system in the fenced off Park area coupled with some spots with overhead shade makes for a good time to relax and watch the kids play, or join in if you prefer. 
The rest of the park is HUGE with lots to offer from 🎾, to 🏀 and a great walking/biking trail. There's a large pond, a stage, a rock climbing and rope climbing portion and often, lots of dogs to meet along the way!
We LOVE this park!
Love this park I can get a good walk with my dogs.

name: John C. Rudy County Park
address: 400 Mundis Race Rd, York, PA 17406, USA
reviews: They have a great dog park for small and large dogs. Wish the lot near the dog park was bigger though! Overflow parking not far away.
Love all the space and my pit Lexi was so happy to run around and play with all the other dogs
Its so much fun its not just what the pic shows there is a other set with bigger slides
Amazing dog park. A wide open fenced in area. My puppy always comes home tired and happy from her visit

Our family rented a pavilion here today. It was a very nice place. There is a playground for children, horseshoe pits,walking trails and within walking distance of a major walking trail. There was also a place to grill using charcoal. Bathroom facilities are wheelchair accessible as are the pavilions. Very lovely day. Pavilions are for rent but you must reserve them in advance or take a chance that you can use a pavilion not reserved.

name: Pastorante
reviews: I visited today with my friend and we both wanted to order the chicken bulgogi. Our waitress was nice to start, and she recommended we order the lunch special which included a side salad. The lunch special was $11 with the salad included where as the dinner portion was $13, so my friend and I both agreed on the lunch special. The food was very good and we enjoyed our meal, but when the waitress brought the checks by, we were both charged the dinner portion ($13) and an extra $3.75 for the side salad. I told the waitress it was a mistake since she had specifically recommended the lunch special which included the salad. She apologized and admitted it was her mistake for not letting us know that we would be charged extra but insisted the manager said there’s nothing they could do. The manager came over and was incredibly rude. There was a bit back and forth between us with me trying to explain the issue. She finally stopped pushing it and grabbed the checks, discounted them, and then brought them back and cleared our table in a forceful way without saying a word. Her demeanor was very unprofessional and caused us to feel awkward and unwelcome. A good business would accommodate for their customers, especially when a mistake was done on their part. I’m glad they discounted the check, and the food was great, but the service needs a bit of work.

Nice, Small restaurant. 

Pastas are all fresh & good except lobster crab mac & cheese. Macaroni was just a bit undercooked.

We had crab guacamole as appetizer,
 oxtail ragu pasta, squid ink pasta with shrimp, and lobster crab mac & cheese as main dishes, 
and Tiramisu and pistachio Gelato as dessert. 

The only complaint was that sauce was a little too salty on all the pasta dishes.  Otherwise they all had very nice flavor.

I 💓💓💓 everything about this restaurant❗  The food is exceptionally yummy & fresh.  The staff is friendly, and intentional about assuring you have a good dining experience and the prices are reasonable.  It's a small place in a cute walkable neighborhood.  It's unique & definitely NOT "like every other restaurant."

Ordered the seafood mac along w lasagna. Order came out on time lasagna had creamy smooth ricotta and seafood mac had lots of crab n shrimp very cheesy a tid bit pricey but def worth the trip thanks guys for staying open

Delicious handmade pasta, great sauce and meatballs, super friendly service. The tiramisu was great, too! Ordered two cappuccinos to drink with dessert. Next time, we'll just order one, and share it, as the cappuccinos were so huge my wife could only drink half. Will definitely come again. Next time, we'll bring a bottle of red wine to drink with dinner. We're so grateful to live within easy walking distance of this amazing restaurant!

name: Mangia Qui
reviews: Service started out a little slow, but the food was incredible.  Just an overall amazing dining experience.  I'm still thinking about the   linguine and clams.  And, the steak was wonderful.  The roasted beet salad was great, so were the cocktails. Five stars.
We loved this place. We definitely want to visit again. The lamb dish and NY steak dish were great. The service was phenomenal by everyone that served us. Thank you!

This place is phenomenal! From our drinks, to our appetizers, to our entrees. Everything was world class. This will be a new staple. Such a great ambiance as well. Seriously just go here immediately! You won't be disappointed!
For $32 I needed a steak knife for my lobster tail. However, the linguini was flavorful and delicate and our Tuscano rib eye was beautiful
Top Notch!  First time dining here and this will be a go to for me.  Service and the dining experience matched the quality of the food perfectly.

name: Dodge City Steakhouse
reviews: Always a great dinner! Service is not super fast but I wouldn't expect it to be. Great specials--don't miss it for the Outdoors Show and Restaurant Weeks. I've never had room for dessert while there, but I've taken home their strawberry shortcake and it is packaged perfectly to enjoy at home.

We just had a wonderful Easter takeout dinner from Dodge City. The portions were great and the food was very good.  We will each get another meal out of it.  It included a salad, full course main meal, rolls with cinnamon butter and dessert. We couldn’t have been happier and the price was reasonable.  And they made the pickup very easy with virtually no contact with another person. Well done Dodge City!

Don't be shallow and judge this book by its cover. Looks shabby and run down on the outside...And frankly, on the interior as well. But the food is amazing. The most tender steak in memory...mozzarella sticks that were actually breaded and fried from real mozzarella. The crab encrusted haddock was perfect with handcut fries from fresh potatoes. The wait staff was attentive and efficient, worthy of a healthy tip. Looking forward to being in the area again for another terrific meal.

Great place for lunch or dinner. In between visits I forget how reasonable their pricing is. I usually get the prime rib sandwich and it is so tender. For only $11 it includes fries (which are fabulous!). The service is prompt and efficient. I've tried their french onion soup - also wonderful.

I was here with a group. I myself did not get steak. Those who did said it was very good. I had the bison tots, which were delicious. The wedge salad was good but not super memorable. The Pork belly mac and cheese was not bad but was underwhelming. Maybe a more creative mix of cheese or a more creative presentation would help that. Maybe a few crispy pork belly pieces on top to suggest the soft pieces that lie beneath and some garnish would go a long way. I had the burger which was generous for the price and the bun, crispy onions, and fries were delicious. My big issue was that I ordered it medium well, and in my opinion it was medium rare at best. If I get sick it will be my fault for not sending it back, I just hate being “that guy”. My first experience was a solid 4 stars.

name: Home 231
reviews: Home 231 is my favorite sit down dining experience in the city of harrisburg. I love how their menu rotates seasonally and how fresh the local ingredients are. The staff is always friendly and offers some of the best service around. They have parking in a few places along the street they are located. Even better than all that though are the phenomenal choices for brunch. Home 231 has consistently been my favorite brunch spot for years, close to a decade now. A true gem in this great city. I’m so thankful to have found this restaurant and look forward to supporting a great local spot for many years to come!

Food was excellent. Service was a little spotty. Our server was pleasant but seemed to forget about us several times, including never bringing the 2nd cocktail that I ordered. Our food took awhile to show up. Maybe because we were outside on the patio? Overall, just need a little more attention to detail.

Went for Sunday brunch and was not disappointed! You need a reservation to get in, so we ended up at the bar but they were still kind and attentive to us there. Really enjoyed the bloody Mary! Had chicken and waffles and the smoked salmon with poached eggs and both were delicious. Definitely check them out for brunch!

Good food, wine & service! Parking is VERY CHALLENGING in this area of town!  We enjoyed the apps: General Tso's Cauliflower (EXCELLENT!), Roasted Veg Board (which is COLD by the way, not hot!!! Also be aware if you share, there won't be enough bread on the board. Asking for additional bread is $1.00 more. At $13 for the board, additional bread if needed shouldn't be an up charge. Just my opinion.) & fish stew as a soup option (which was very spicy to my palate & I sent it back, unusual for me). Dinner: We shared the cornbread which tasted great but it took a considerable amount of  time for the honey butter to come out so it didn't melt. I had the short rib w/grits (Amazing!!!), my husband had the rabbit which had a lot of bones & was very messy to cut the way it was served in the bowl with the other ingredients but he said it tasted good. For dessert, he had the 3 flavors of ice cream which was great & I had the apple cobbler...just ok & was cool in the center, not warm. Perhaps if we went on a weekday & not a busy Friday, the food would have been a bit better as expected by all the previous reviews. Don't get me wrong, it was good but for $165 (with tip) it should have been perfect. I don't mind spending money for great food that's worth it. We'll give it another try on a week night to see if the food is as good as previous Yelp & Google reviews. Service was excellent & we felt well attended to (Service gets 5 stars).
Cozy brunch spot. Great Bloody Maria. Good food. Friendly service. A few more vegetarian options would be awesome, but I wasn't without some nice choices.

name: Cafe Fresco Center City
reviews:
Definitely a solid choice for brunch in downtown Harrisburg overall. The drinks get a little pricy but the food is reasonable for the level of quality and flavor. I had the Oyster Rockefeller Benedict which was I have to say was one of the best around. 

It would have been a 5 star review for the food overall, however being that has been my second time at Cafe Fresco and each time my food took 45 minutes to an hour and 15 minutes to come out. 

Speed it up and it's a 5 star restaurant!
I really enjoy eating lunch at this location. The cashier was friendly the options are plentiful and I don’t have to wait long for my food to come out. Pleasantly surprised

We dropped by for the Saturday Brunch. The food was uniformly excellent. My wife had a wonderful omelet, my breakfast baguette was fantastic. Our grandkid had pancakes with bananas and bourbon caramel sauce.  The service should have been better. The woman was nice and friendly, but oh so slow. We spent an hour an a half in the restaurant. It took ages to get the check because she spent that long gabbing with a coworker. So if you are in Harrisburg on Saturday, you want some really good food and a lot of time to kill, this is the place to go.
This is a great place to eat, when you are Downtown, in Harrisburg. What makes it great, is the food and cocktails. The atmosphere and the staff professionalism is excellent.

Everything is outstanding.  Don't miss the roasted to perfection crispy brussel sprouts and my entree:  Sriracha Panko Salmon with black rice risotto, yuzo-dill creme fraiche & asparagus... DELICIOUS!

name: El Sol Mexican Restaurant
reviews: This place was awesome. Their brunch menu is pretty good, with huge portions and perfectly priced. Plenty of vegetarian choices as well. The service was fantastic - great with kids and a big group. The build your own Bloody Mary station was a nice touch!

We were traveling to see family for the holidays and got to talking with our flights captain before we boarded and asked if he had any recommendations for dining in Harrisburg and he recommended El Sol.

Nice atmosphere and decor, we felt like we were dining in a restaurant in Mexico. Come to find out the owner and head chef is from Mexico and he takes an incredible amount of pride in his place. You can tell that but the decor and more specifically the food.

You definitely won't leave hungry as they have huge portions and everything we ordered was served hot and tasty. We decided to sit in the bar and the bartender Mark was awesome. Great recommendations for the cocktails we had and he didn't skimp on the alcohol. 

Definitely not expensive either like you would expect for a more upscale Mexican restaurant.  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is interested in having some great food and great service.

Safe Travels! SPGDL_Traveler

I understand the pressure but this restaurant was unorganized with orders. As people were in and out I waited two hours for an order I never received. I also understand due to the epidemic the orders are coming in fast. But as a business you should respond to orders as received and continue to update the customers rather then tell them you don’t know where their order is. Orders were made through the phone and they had memory of taking the order. Horrible place with horrible employees, please find employees who are dedicated instead of being frustrated every time a customer comes in.
It's hard to find parking. But wow! The food was so freaking good! Best Mexican food I have ever had. The waiters are super kind and very welcoming. The fried ice cream is AMAZING as well!!!!!

Very Friendly Staff and Manager !!!
I Recommend this place.
A couple things need some changes and I'm glad that the Manager was Open minded to get the Restaurant to Invite New Customers in to Experience this place.
Check out the make your own Bloody Mary Bar... I've never seen this before.

name: Char's Tracy Mansion
address: 1829 N Front St, Harrisburg, PA 17102, USA
reviews: Being a college student, I'm by no means accustomed to fine dining. However, I took my girlfriend here one night because I wanted to treat her to something special, and special it was. For starters, the atmosphere was great. There was live music that night, and the decor wasn't over the top or anything- it was just right. Second, our waitress was a class act,  she was helpful with opinions on wine and menu items. The moscato was absolutely amazing, and our food was delicious (I had the scallop dish- would recommend). After our meal we walked the river front and it was one of the most perfect dates I've ever had. I will definitely return from time to time.

Amazing! The food was spectacular and the service top notch. We loved the bread we were served as we were seated so the waiter brought us a box of the bread to take home with us at the end of the night. She had the lime and risotto shrimp, I had scallops. Dessert was a warm chocolate souffle... Heaven on a plate. The only down side was the noise level. The manager moved us to a quieter table in a corner that has sound dampening panels around it. So much better. The next time we go we will probably ask to be seated in the library. Highly recommend visiting the mansion.

Because of some health issues I have decided to cut meat out of my diet.
January 31st. Is my last day for meat.
So I wanted to come here for my last meal (of meat) I had the prime rib, bone in.
I ordered it medium rare. With garlic mashed potatoes and fresh veggies.
I have been a meat eater my whole life.
I have dined at Ruth Chris in Boston as well as Atlanta and Chicago, and those places are very good, but I would stack up the prime rib that I had at Char's against any one of those other places!
I really mean that. It was done just right (and you don't get that much in Harrisburg PA) there was enough fat to add to the flavor, without being too fatty and the mashed and veggies we're good as well.
I also like the cappuccino that I got after the meal. All in all it was a great meal. You could argue that it was somewhat pricey, but it was with it to finally get what I ordered, the way I ordered it.
I will be back  had a chance to talk to the executive chef and understand why the food is good.  He loves the art of cooking and their fish is fresh daily.  So good!

The food and atmosphere at Char's are exceptional. In the summer, the view of the river is so pretty. The servers are attentive and know their stuff. But the food is the star here. Favorites include the escargot appetizer and the risotto of the day. This time it was a parmesan crusted chicken breast with sausage risotto. Yum. A great place for celebrations and for anytime you want an amazing dinner.

name: Las Delicias Restaurante
reviews: This is an absolutely amazing place to get some great Caribbean food! I absolutely love their empanadas and pepper steak! Get whatever is on the menu, you truly can't go wrong! It's a fast, excellent,  buffet style setup.  Trust me, you will go back!
Best food best service!!
They had a lot of options, very clean place, they made my tostones very fast.
Clean place delicios food freindly people
Dominican food..... great food great service

name: Bangkok 56
reviews: I was first introduced to Thai cuisine here and since I have introduced many family members and friends to it too. This still remains my favorite Thai restaurant. Although it's small - and honestly looks questionable from the outside - the inside atmosphere is very cozy, and the food is excellent. Best to make a reservation if you're planning to go during a busy time of day.

Best Thai place in the area! Great service and very welcoming! The ingredients are fresh and authentic! Can’t believe I found an authentic Thai place in Harrisburg, PA. I had the Tom Yum soup, Thai Seafood salad and Pad Thai and the taste is amazing! If you enjoy local Thai flavors don’t miss this place!

This place is fantastic. Every dish is an explosion of good tastes, smells and great visual presentation.  Don't let the small parking lot and modest dining area fool you.  I would put this place in it's own special Asian food category.  If you haven't tried it, then you for sure should go and sample their board of fare.  Also, you can tell the wait person how spicy you want the food.
Food was great! Tasted very fresh and authentic like Thai food should be

The prices for amazing food are reasonable and won't break your lunch budget. The variety of options and levels of spice leaves the patron with a welcome tough choice. Please note that Thai hot is very hot. While they are not open on Monday, you will find them busy other days of the week. The only issue is parking. I highly recommend car pooling if possible.

name: Bacco Pizzeria and Wine Bar
reviews: I had lunch here yesterday. It was delicious and a step up from your normal pizza shop! The bar tender was friendly and down to earth. She was pleasant company but also did her job and let me eat in peace. I will be back with others. Thanks!
Perfect atmosphere, not to crowded. Amazing food. I got the crab cakes and veggies. Relaxing and laid back service. Jean Paul was awesome! Ask for him!

Saturday around 7:30, I came in with a group of about 15 sober people to simply have a drink in the bar area. We made it easy on the bartender (who also called himself the General Manager) by ordering beer or wine rather than time-consuming craft cocktails. We did not occupy any of the tables or chairs and simply stood around the bar. This GM was overwhelmed and made us know it. As soon as we all got our drinks (and tipped him out), he became incredibly rude and told us the space was reserved for dinner guests with reservations even though we were feet away from the tables. After a few minutes, my mother-in-law calmly mentioned to him that his approach was aggressive and could have been handled better and he literally had a melt down and began yelling at her! He then proceeded to threaten to kick us out and said the owner would agree. He told us we could take the owner's card and call him - that his cell phone number was on it. Today I called the number only to find that it is not a cell phone, no one answered, there is no voicemail, and the email address is a general account for the business. In short, I've always thought the food was mediocre and overpriced, but I've always loved the bar and atmosphere. We were treated so rudely and for no reason (other than spending a few hundred dollars in 15 minutes) that now I can't even enjoy the bar. The bar-tender/GM was incredibly inappropriate and unprofessional. He should not be working in customer service.

Absolutely love Bacco- it’s a must-visit in downtown Harrisburg!! I’ve been going with my boyfriend consistently since we moved to the area, and we love the food, service and atmosphere here. The Happy Hour specials are THE BEST- I highly recommend coming here after work during the week with friends. On weekends, there’s always a great crowd at the bar. John at the bar is amazing- he’s such a knowledgeable bartender and foodie. I can’t say enough good things!
Came here for lunch one day. Great food and service. Wish we stopped by after 1pm though. That’s when their happy hour starts.

name: 1700 Degrees Steakhouse
reviews: The food was very good and so was our waitress. However, I’m not so sure about the reception though. We arrived at 5:26pm for our reservation for 5:30pm and was told that we needed to wait until they open at 5:30pm. Which was fine, but then we didn’t get seated until 5:34pm, even though we were the only ones there...very interesting operation.
Was really good food.. service was excellent.. my first time enjoying a Tomahawk steak

Ohh!! How should I start, always had great experience at Hilton’s, no matter where you are. Never had issues with Hilton’s, after got disappointed at one restaurant went to Hilton’s made my day and night. Amazing service, great menu, beautiful ambience. Everything perfect!!!!! The perfect Hilton the perfect restaurant. Just look at the preparation and work marvelous......

Amazing dinner tonight! The steak, the sides and the drinks were perfect and the service was stellar. So excited to have found an NYC quality steakhouse right here in Central PA! We cannot wait to return.
Thoroughly enjoyed the Tomahawk Steak. Scott Hamdon was an AWESOME waiter! Very friendly and knowledgeable! Definitely will be back.

name: The Jackson House
reviews: I heard rave reviews about the restaurant but was disappointed. I ordered Lester burger and asked for hot sauce. There was no hot sauce. I also order a side of fries and the fries were in tiny bits and they were burnt. Maybe I will give them another try in the future and order something else.

Hands down, the best burgers, subs, and cheesesteaks in the Harrisburg area (and beyond). An old fashioned style Italian deli inside, this family run business slings food equal to the best joints in NY, Philly, etc.  Hours are only Mon thru Fri, 10:30am to 2:00pm, and rusty are closed on all state holidays. They are cash only and usually busy.  Burgers are cooked to order. I can't say enough good things about this place, their food is THE example of delicious.

Great burger!! It's a little pricey, but I can definitely see why they keep winning best burger in Harrisburg. Family owned and managed, and they are awesome. Super friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere. It's a mixer of Philly and NYC right in the heart of Harrisburg. The French 
Fries are fresh cut and the oil and sea salt is done perfectly. Everyone needs to experience this place.
The hallmark of a quality cheeseburger is when you pick it up and the juice runs down to your elbows. That was the burger I had today. Thick, and juicy. Great little spot for lunch!
Great food and friendly service.  The burger I had was superb. Just be aware that if you go, it's cash only.

name: Los Tres Cubanos Restaurant
reviews:
We went without a reservation on a weeknight. It is a cute little place, and I could see it filling up quickly. The decor is nicely done. I love the out side tables, but I was happy to be in the air conditioned inside.

I started out with a mojito. It was tasty and the sugar cane was a nice touch. 

I got the steak special (32) and my husband a pork dish (22) so we could share. The meat flavors were rich and complex. The rice and beans were much simpler. 

It was a great meal and we will be back.

Love Tres Cubanos.  We have been here several times.  You dream of a mojito--that's it.  Great cocktails all around and everything on the menu is better then expected.  Most restaurants in Harrisburg are hit-or-miss.  Tres Cubanos is not.  Consistently great food.
Great place. The Cuban bartender Aerial, great guy ...A++
Awesome food.  The service was top of the line.  Could not ask for a better waitress. Atmosphere was great.  Myself and coworkers had a great evening.
Loved the food, really good, it made me feel like  I was back in my beautiful country Cuba.

name: Sammy's Authentic Italian Restaurant
reviews: Visited this location on two different occasions within the last six months because I am now employed downtown and can easily walk there on my lunch break. Both times the service was horrible! The first time I did carry out the portions were too small, the second time coworkers and I ate the buffet the food was bland and not enough options. The server was rude, I was the only Black person at a table of 4 and He didn’t clean my dirty plate until the lady next to me told him to
Awesome atmosphere awesome view and fantastic homemade food. Fresh spices. One of my favorite places worth hour and 20 minute drive 🙂

Today is my first time dining at this small, quaint establishment.  It was party of 16 I think. We placed everyone's order two days before. When we arrived, they had everything ready for us.  We got our drinks right away, than our salads, than our meals. I think everyone had everything in 30 minutes... AND it was hot. Very impressed! I'll def be recommending this place
Great food, great service. Love the authentic Italian dishes. Can’t beat the loacation at the base of the capitol steps as well!
Excellent server and dinner.  So happy to find vegetarian options on the menu.  We will be back.

name: Freshido
reviews: I tried this place on a whim and was not disappointed. Excellent quality of food and large portions for the price. I got mine to go, but the restaurant looked clean and tidy. I will definitely be headed back there soon.

This is my favorite low key spot for a date night. It's affordable and delicious. If you are looking for a date night location, this spot is nestled right in strawberry square. There are lights strung up over the street and it's gorgeous at night. While this restaurant doesn't provide the cocktails that one might want to enjoy during an evening out, there are many bars and a couple more restaurants near by that serve alcohol. There's also a cute, authentic crepe spot just a hop skip and jump away for dessert.  Easily my favorite area of Harrisburg.

Great Poke Bowl Restaurant if you need a quick in and out or to go or just sit down and enjoy the atmosphere while eating a delicious healthy food this is the place to go in Harrisburg, PA. Totally recommend it, available street parking with park i meter in the area. 
We had 2 bowls: 
-Freshido Special.
-Turf & Surf.
Favorite place to get lunch in Harrisburg. Great food and great service! Had an issue with an order and Ben C. had it fixed right away.
I love any place where I can pick exactly what goes in my good. Great poke.

name: Ad Lib Craft Kitchen & Bar
reviews: This place is so good with the choices of food that they have. Monkey bread and Brie for an appetizer. Marinated chicken wings for an appetizer and grilled octopus for entree. Oh my God so good so wonderful please if you're in Harrisburg check this place out

Stellar experience, honestly. I took my wife here for her 40th birthday, and we were both blown away by the service and quality of food. Our server Parker was very attentive and Michael the bartender went out of his way to make a custom drink that would make my wife’s evening extra special. 

I have to recommend this place to anyone looking for a quality experience.

Ad Lib has a great menu.  Their lunch specials are presented on a large, rectangular plate and offer a good value for the price and quality.  Their clam chowder is possibly the best I've ever had - rich and creamy with bacon added to enhance the flavor.  If you're a burger lover, you would be hard pressed to find one better than the Ad Lib Burger.  It is served on a pretzel roll with stone ground mustard (containing large seeds) and hand cut fries on the side.  Finally, if you're a seafood lover, order a couple of the giant shrimp from the 1700 Steakhouse menu. They are an expensive treat, but well worth it. Overall, Ad Lib delivers a superior dining experience which is commensurate with the price.

We have been wanting to check this place out for a while and it did not disappoint. For starters the Bloody Mary's were spiced to perfection. Then I had the Pork Cheek Rye Bagel which was crazy good with hot sauce cream cheese!

Service was very good and quick!

The burger I ordered was pretty decent even if the fries were a bit lacking. My wife ordered meatballs and was highly underwelmed by them. The cocktail and other alcoholic beverage options seem to be the strong suit here. I wouldn't be opposed to returning to explore more of the menu however so overall I will say I enjoyed my visit here but I have also had much more impressive experiences elsewhere.

name: Burger Yum
reviews: The Yum Burger is amazing. I don't understand all the natural, organic or whatever. I do understand taste. It is fresh and amazingly delicious! You have to experience it. Good atmosphere. Great staff-quick and friendly.

The food at Burger Yum is fantastic. If you are looking for a smash style burger, fries, and a milk shake Burger Yum is for you. I didn't get to try the Chicken sandwich but I will be next time. The staff was courteous and the location is great.

Burger Yum is the best burger in Harrisburg!!!

The burgers are very juicy and cooked perfectly. The Yum Sauce is delicious and a great addition to any of their sandwiches. The chicken sandwich rivals any other in the industry. The french fries are great, including the parmesan fries.

I love the quaint atmosphere and the owner is very friendly and a valuable part of the Harrisburg community.  Keep up the great work!

My friend and I always order the strawberry smoothie, loaded fries and chilly bacon dogs right after we leave HACC. Sheetz used to be our spot but to be honest, not no more😂😂💀. The food here is SO good and the energy the employees give off is amazing. I love how chill the vibe of the atmosphere is and everyone is really nice and down to earth.
I’ve been eating cheeseburgers a long time, this is by far best burger since I was a kid! If you’re near by make this a stop on your list. So good!!!

name: Au Bon Lieu
reviews: Such a quaint little spot tucked downtown! Huge menu with over 80 varieties of crepes. Outdoor seating for when the weather is nice. Authentic French music (at least I think) playing at all times. Reasonable prices, too. Lovely Friday night spot.

Great crepes! And the owner was very kind. A homeless person walked in and the owner asked him if he was hungry. Then he proceeded to provide him with some food. I offered to pay for that person's food but the owner refused to accept any payment! Definitely coming back here again.

THIS MAN IS THE TRUTH. Friendliest man alive. Extremely polite , caring and fun. Pretty little establishment and the crepes were TO.DIE.FOR. I think I wanted to spend an entire paycheck on Nutella banana crepes. 10/10 recommend

My husband by ourselves or with friends and family have been coming here for years. The shop is intimate and cozy with window nooks and pillows and fur. In warmer weather there are cafe tables outside. It is very convenient to the Harrisburg Symphony and Open Stage and the Gamut Theatre and State Museum and Whitaker Center for example. We stop in for a dessert crepe and coffee or tea after a show or between meals after a museum visit. We go for lunch or dinner before a show and get a savory crepe/salad and a dessert crepe plus a drink for 1/2 the price of a meal at other restaurants and although it feels like time slows down a bit at Au Bon Lieu, the timing of the service is perfect and we always get to the show on time!
Convenient location with good menu options and customer service.

name: Rubicon
reviews: Restaurant and bar are seemingly clean and nice. Service was decent. We were there on New year's and ordered drinks early that came out in good time and made correctly. Once they got busy, they were unable to handle their bar, and the drinks came out inconsistent, and worse tasting as the night went on. The drinks were top dollar, so for that price I expect them to be on point. The last round was so bad we decided not to drink them.

Holy cow this place is good. The Rubicon Mule was fantastic, such great flavor profiles. The steak is great. The accompanying potatoes are not great. I certainly suggest substituting them out. Honestly, the steak is so large, you won't even need to worry about the side item.

Atmosphere is very relaxing, tastefully done, and preserves the architecture of the building with a slight (very slight) modern feel.

Food is very good, menu offers something for all tastes.  Specialty cocktail menu is a nice touch as well.  We'll be back!
Staff were excellent! Only ordered starters and drinks. Escargot and mussels were great! Wine was excellent. The decor was underwhelming, I expected more I guess.
Always good but the bar is what I love about this place.  The food has never disappointed.  The staff is friendly without being overly attentive.  They have the best burger around

name: Carley's Ristorante
reviews:
Although on the pricier side, Carley's is a lovely place to dine that offers live piano entertainment every weekend. We were there on an off day for the piano bar, but a patron was allowed to play piano by the owner and regaled us with what amounted to a tiny concert for our table as barring that patron, we were the only other guests for a while. 

I would highly recommend this place. The food is superb. The owner treats patrons like family. And the music is just the icing on the cake.
Wonderful place,  great piano bar. A nice remnant of restaurant row.
Cute place! Loved the live piano music, the food was great, and it was a lovely atmosphere! Service was good too 👍

Would have liked to given 4 stars, but I just couldn't.  Is it it a downtown fine dining establishment or just an everyday place?  The piano player while very good was loud when we first arrived such that my wife and I had to talk in elevated voices to hear each other.  I finally asked our waitress if she could ask for lower volume, which she did and then once lowered I thought was appropriate for dining.  The food was good, but not extraordinary.   Our waitress was just OK as well.  Worth a try.

I have always had a wonderful experience any time I have gone to Carley’s. Though I was introduced to the location through Show Tune Sunday, I have been a patron outside of that event. The staff is always kind and professional. It’s my go-to recommendation for people new to Harrisburg. I look forward to my next visit.

name: Keystone Restaurant
reviews: Food is amazing here, always comes out fresh and taste really good. Price is within reason as well. You would have to pay for parking around the area during the week even Saturday.  But Sunday is free parking, has nothing to do with the restaurant. Family owned business and the people here are polite and attentive. Safe area right down the street from the cap5so you can walk off those calories if you like.
Easy, fast, classic breakfast. Open kitchen gives a great atmosphere! Get there early or you may have to wait! Very busy on weekends!!
Good service. Good food. Small town prices.
Quick service, cheap prices and family-owned. Love this place!

Great breakfast friendly staff. I had there bacon and cheese omelette and my partner had French toast with eggs and beef sausage. Amazing portions great food loved it. Very fast and filling. If we are back in the area we will be coming back.

name: Cork & Fork
reviews: Awesome and distinct food choice. Loved every single thing we ordered. Great recommendations by our server!! Will come back

This place is great! Just in town for one night and we happened upon it. The happy hour is totally nuts. The food is so delicious — the scallop risotto is such a treat and the sopressata pizza is spot-on authentic Italian. Our server, Danica, was so cool, too. Happy to recommend this spot!
This place it’s amazing! First time here and the customer service is excellent and food delicious! Definitely coming back here. Recommend 20/10 lol

Such exquisite cocktails made with the creative spirit of folks who know their spirits. Jonathan the mixologist was extremely welcoming and knowledgeable about the menu and beverage pairings. His testimonials and creations behind the bar were welcome and enjoyed by all.

My husband and I decided to stop here after Little Amps Coffee Roaster and we are so glad we did. They were offering their brunch menu. Which was smaller plates and it was all so delicious and fresh. They make all of their dough, sauces, dressings, and pastas in house. The gnocchi with cherry tomato sauce was the favorite of everything we had gotten. We also had the veal meatballs, margherita pizza, and sopressata. It was all so amazing. We will definitely be going back.

name: The Sturges Speakeasy
reviews: Lively atmosphere, a variety of sports on the TVs the vibe you want in your neighborhood bar. We sat in the bar side to watch everything, the bartender although busy was totally attentive. Cold beers out within minutes of ordering, menus brought for when we were ready. It was our first time there and we will for sure be back!

Hands done, bar none, one of the best places that I've ever had a meal and I have particular standard's. I like my steak well-done and most places I have to send it back, sometimes more then once. When I told the waitress what I wanted, she said I'll tell them to kill it. My steak was cooked to perfection, and the asparagus and mashed potatoes were full of flavor. The drinks were 🔥. That bartender is a master of his craft. They were packed on the first floor, but upstairs was nice an intimate. The calamari and the potato soup was delicious. The peanut butter pie was heavenly. This was one of the best dining/culinary experiences I've ever had.

The waiter was very nice and helpful, he recommended the espresso martini and it was delicious! The sandwiches we got were really good too and pretty big. They also have a nice, little deck with tables and a bar.
My 'Pittsburg style' steak salad was delicious!  It was a first for me to have fries in a salad but it definitely worked. Big beer selection and great prices.

Had a great time.  Good selection of drinks and a wonderful atmosphere. The bar is on one half and tables on the other. There is normally music in the evening.
The steak salad was good and the bar tenders on point.

name: Stock's on 2nd
reviews:
I came in the door and immediately greeted with a server named Christina. 
She asked me where I wanted to be seated which in other places they just put me where they wanted.
I sat down didn't rush me too order which I love. I mean who likes to be rushed when trying to pick the right choice or anything at that. I ordered Buffalo wings and Crispy short rib 🍟 fries. Man the wings were the best I had in a long time perfectly cooked 👌. Had the fries with beer cheese OMG i can eat fries with that cheese all day every day. I'll definitely be coming back here again.
I love the rustic, country decorations. Food was delicious and our waiter was very helpful. I'd highly recommend this place.

Very nice place! We went on a Monday evening and it was very empty. I'm sure it would be busy on the weekends. We loved the atmosphere. The food was nice serving size. I got the brisket and it was very good!!
Had a great experience, I love this place. Happy our deals were solid. Our server mike was a 11/10. He had great food recommendations and an incredible personality. Man deserves a raise.
Food was tasty. Waiter was pretty agressive and pushy. Sometimes he was pleasant, but not consistently. Weird experience.

name: Café 1500
reviews: Good food, excellent ambience. We didn't like the Buddha bowl but it is because this was the first time we were trying Golden beets  and it turned out we were not a fan of it. So if you have tasted golden beets before and don't care for it then please don't order Buddha bowl. Apart from this, everything else was perfect!

I wanna give it four stars but the past few times I have came here, it has been pretty disappointing. Two different occasions I went to order something, they didn't have the I ingredients to make it.... Last time I've been (a few weeks ago) we waited forever and our food came out cool. It didn't even seem that busy. Great cocktails though, that hasn't changed. I definitely will be back for some bottomless mimosas but may hang tight on the food. I hope they can improve themselves!

The food here was good and so was the service.  Although there are reservations required for tables, but none required for the bar. The servers were very friendly.   I had the 5 course meal.  The Korean fried chicken was delicious and so was the flight chicken.  I would go there again.
Food and staff was amazing more people should come here literally had the whole restaurant to our selves.

Looking for Brunch on a Sunday Morning? Cafe 1500 is where you need to be!  A Craft of Mimosas (4 glasses $20) great deal, cornbread battered house pancakes, crab floretine omelettes, amazing french toast and a divine avocado toast for sharing!

Absolutely stunning atmosphere! 
Fresh green plants, hospitable waiters/waitresses, great open space, outdoor seating,  fresh food, fast service and reasonably priced! 
I had a great time at Cafe 1500. And if I'm in PA again, I'll be back!

name: Tres Hermanos
address: 712 S Cameron St, Harrisburg, PA 17104, USA
reviews: Cant beat them with real authenticity food and product's keep the good work🙏🏽👌🏽

This is a great place with very authentic products. The staff is friendly and everything tastes great. They have a small bar for onions, pick, and salsa. Highly recommend! There's also a Mexican store in the back where you can get authentic Mexican foods, juices, candy, breads, meats, and spices, as well as boots, souvenirs and other Mexican trinkets.

Definitely one of the best places around! If you're craving Mexican cuisine it's the only place I recommend to anyone. Incredible, fresh, and flavorful food. Excellent service. Overall best place around. If I could give a higher rating I would!
Very authentic and very tasty dishes.  Also very affordable.  Simple decor with a grocery in back.  One of my favorite restaurants in Harrisburg.  Highly recommended.
Being from Colorado, I am always craving authentic and delicious Mexican food.  Thankfully, I finally found it here!  AMAZING FOOD!

name: Garden Vietnamese Restaurant
reviews: Picked this up to go! Quick and easy, price is great.  Quality is off the scale.  The just have great food!  Service is fast, polite staff.  Very pleased!
The food here was good. The coffee as well. If you're looking for vietnamese fare there should do nicely. Nothing major stands out, however everything was very solid and as it should be.
This restaurant has the best service and egg rolls you should try it for whoever is reading this.
Fine spot for tasty Vietnamese food. Came here on a Friday I think. Looking forward to returning with my relatives. The bill was appropriate for the quality. Similar to a place in Denver I liked.
This is definitely one of my most favorite little restaurants. It's fun with friends or just some quiet time for yourself. The food is the absolute best and the staff is awesome.

name: Kanlaya Thai Restaurant
reviews: Brings back memories of the food in Thailand especially the   tom yang soup with mushroom. Salad is spicy which is good. Staff is friendly and efficient. Spacious dining area. Food serving is large enough for a group meal.

I really enjoyed my meal i had. Crispy KaPow chicken and it tasted great. I am not sure what everyone else at my table had but they all enjoyed their meals. Will definitely be back. The portions were a lot too. Have some left overs for later.
Excellent food!!! I really loved the pot stickers, spicy fried rice and the drunken chicken noodles... Also a special mention to the mango sticky rice which was an amazing dessert!!

Came back for the second time this trip. I’m usually going to only new places, but this place got me hooked the first time I had to come back. The menu I had 2 days in a row, from bottom to top.
They all taste very authentic. I highly recommend as a Thai.
Always good food and best bubble tea Harrisburg

name: Miyako Sushi
reviews: best sushi around! love the valentine roll. everything is always super fresh & they have a remarkable amount of options at reasonable prices.

Very good quality sushi! I was thoroughly impressed. The prices weren't that bad as well. I eat a lot of sushi and am used to all you can eat specials for $20-$30. Here I had the 2 for $14 special which wasn't bad. It took a little long for the sushi to come out when it felt like we were 1 of 3 other customers here but that's just my experience. Would love to see an all you can special.
I ordered delivery and it came fast and still warm. I had the Yum Yum Roll, Philly Roll, and Pork Gyoza. All of it was amazing and I'll definitely order from there again.
I’ve been here 50+ times and every single time I am blown away by the customer service and cuisine. The owner and staff are polite and hardworking. Very proud to have them downtown.

The sushi here is pretty good. Presentation is also good as well. I tried sushi here before and this time tried there combination fried rice. Was pretty average but not bad. I haven't had a bad experience here just okay.

name: Millworks
reviews: Good beer, good food and great service. Went on Saturday around 1pm and place was pretty full. Service couldn't have been better. Orders arrived to the table quicker than expected and everything tasted amazing. Parking can be tricky but just be patient because its worth it. Also several nice artist shops inside. First time visitor and was impressed. Wish there were more places like this!

Food was sooo good. I wish I could eat more to try everything! Service was great. I particularly appreciate the kids menu with coloring and the salt dough. It's great to have a place to go with good for and drinks that the kids will enjoy too. Love the local ingredients!

Good beer selection. Their brewer seems to know the way to a good beer.
The food's..... Marginal. The wife's burger was cooked perfectly and had a nice char taste. The fries were hot but slightly undercooked.
I went for the pierogies. Didn't find the burnt ends on my plate and they were very dry dumplings. Nothing like the menu described and the main reason I picked the restaurant for the evening.
Maybe the chef was having a bad night but...
Not Recommended beyond bar food.
:D

I'd made a reservation for yesterday for a party of 8; it was for a birthday celebration for my boyfriend. The server was really friendly, the beer was delicious, and the food came out super fast. For a starter I got the Butternut Squash Bisque, which was phenomenal, and for the main course I got the Vegan Mushroom Stroganoff. Aside from it being extremely salty, it was still delicious. That was really the only vegan/vegetarian thing I seen on the menu (other than pizza). Of course, I was also chatting with 7 other people while I was looking at the menu, so I could've easily missed something. It was my first time here and there was so much to see! I can't wait to come back in the summertime and see the rooftop!
Holy wow! First time here and we will certainly will be back! Atmosphere felt very cozy and staff was very friendly. The food was spot on amazing and you could tell that everything was just so fresh.

name: Subway Café
reviews: The Subway is a long established (1948) Italian restaurant.  I've been eating here since 1965.  Their Pizza won a Harrisburg area contest as the best Pizza, which was judged by the owners the five best Pizza restaurants in the area.  There is one personal size and it has a thin cracker crust along with all the other typical Italian food.  This place has been thriving for over 70 years in a downtown location in an era when restaurants are failing as quickly as they can open.  Go there & enjoy it!!

I hadn't been here in years, but always remembered them for their peanut butter pie. I went in tonight with my boyfriend since he had never been there before. Our food was DELICIOUS!! He got a personal pizza, homemade sweet sauce & LOTS of it! I had the toasted ravioli bites (which are really hard to find these days). Sauce waa awesome! Had bits of meat in it (which is ALSO hard to find). Our waitress was Carmen & she was a sweetheart. Good price for the excellent meals you get. We will be returning--highly recommend!! They also carry a decent size wine selection as well!

Best pizza in the area. If you like thin crust pizza you must try it. It is clear why this establishment has been around for so long. We have been coming here for many years and come back time and time again. All my family and friends love it too. Try the amazing house dressing on your salad and if you want a fantastic dessert try the peanut butter pie. Yum!
The pizza is good, thin and crisp. Fast and friendly staff great lunch spot
Delicious comfort food and excellent service. Strongly recommended!

name: The Vegetable Hunter- Plant-Based Cafe & Boutique Brewery
reviews: This is a hidden foodie gem!  If you thought plant based would be tasteless, you better think again and try the sweet potato salad, not what you would expect and the mushroom risotto was out of this world and they made me my own special dessert!  It was so well thought out and perfect, every detail.  You must try this awesome food!

First visit here was pleasant. Staff was friendly and food had a amazing presentation. Parking ended up costing $4 for an hour and 20 minutes. Beer was better than expected.

Mac and cheese was only okay. Might need to try it again, but overall a nice experience.
I'm not a vegan, but open to trying new foods. I got the black bean burger with spicy beets on the side. Both were delicious and will be going back to try other stuff. Check them out!

WOW! This place is incredible. Our family visited on a snow day and had the place to ourselves. They cooked us up a feast. EVERYTHING is plant-based. The food was delicious and we cannot wait to visit again.

The food was fresh and awesome. The staff was great.
 Im not a Vegan but I really enjoyed the food as a change of pace. Very good selection s on the menu
I didn't try the beer but I will next time Im back in the area

name: Crawdaddys
reviews: First time actually eating there. I was there for a retirement lunch for a colleague. We were a large group that emailed our menu choice ahead of time. Everything was ready when we got there. Our place settings were labeled with our name and meal selection. As we were seated our food was brought out. Everything was delicious. Not one complaint. Our Server was attentive, and the Owner came out to greet us. It was a wonderful dining experience.

The food was just okay. Some seasoned well, some not enough and some was dry and overcooked. Space is very small. Dance area, bar and tables, plus DJ. We were seated at a table that was clearly in the way and we were bumped all night by people walking back and forth. Food was a little too pricey for what we got. I would love to try some more from their menu. I'd try to go when it was a little less crowded maybe.

Our waitress Ms Paula was excellent, however our food was not prepared as ordered. The owner was not accommodating and refused to hear our concerns because he felt he already addressed the issue despite us wanting to address other concerns. Its unfortunate that black owned establishments have poor professional service especially when your willing to patronize them.

I appreciate your response, however the Birthday Club and their event had nothing to do with the lack of  customer service my party and I received in the dining room.   I ordered a salmon salad and received a piece of salmon on a plate. I requested it be sent back and it was rushed back to me over a salad mix. Presentation was not flattering. Others received their food sporadically causing some to eat and complete their meals before others. Because it was a Birthday celebration many didn't want to upset the Birthday honoree by complaning about their food and lack of professionalism. We tipped our wait staff  handsomely, and strongly noted that we would not forget our treatment and experience. We should have been notified when we were seated by the manager and waitress about all house, happy hour, and dinner specials. We arrived prior to 7pm. Management should never dispute the customer especially a group of mature,  professional, proud paying women.

We all loved our food. It was delicious. Very well seasoned so the flavor was off the charts. It reminded us of New Orleans. We definitely plan to dine there again.  And the service was delightful just rounded off the entire experience. I had the voodoo juice and gumbo with shrimps.

The service was great! The food was pretty good, just not as good as I remember it being. My mom had the shrimp and grits. She absolutely loved it! The grilled chicken was a pleaser too. I was not too crazy about the fried chicken wings! We had a little group and the atmosphere was nice.

name: Bollywood Bar and Grille
reviews: Excellent food and super friendly people! I will be returning. The $9.99 lunch buffet is simply amazing. Delicious and fresh food. Very clean establishment. I am beyond impressed!

We decided to stop here for dinner on a Sunday. The place was empty. We were a bit worried, because usually that is a sign that it's not very popular. Let me tell you, the food was AMAZING!!  The staff was very kind, and as we were waiting to order, more and more people came in. It did take a very long time for our food to be served, but I feel that is because the food is very high quality. Each and every item was obviously cooked with such care. The flavors were amazing and to be honest, it was honestly some of the best Indian food I have ever had!! My one and only 'complaint' is that many people know that to get really good food, it takes a long prep time. So there were quite a few orders that were placed through Grub-Hub. We kept seeing orders go out, and I started to feel a little neglected, because our order seemed to take a long time to finally be brought out. But let me tell you. It was WORTH it!! I would wait an hour to have their food again! I am most definitely looking forward to returning! And , next time, I'm going to order a whole slew of food to take back with me, so I can have it the next day!!!

Love the vegetarian options and they have a couple of unique fishes. Great service. We usually get carryout and are always satisfied. I do wish the buffet had more veggie options but regardless the food is really good.
Really great food with a friendly staff making some excellent recommendations.  If you like culinary flavors and meals from India, this place should be on your must visit list.

Wish I still lived in Harrisburg so I could order food from here more often. Food is spiced well and the flavors are good, not too heavy and service has always been good whenever we are there! Looking forward to coming here whenever we visit the area.

name: Cidra's Cabana Restaurant
reviews: Grrreat!!!! Huge Portions!!! Yummy Alot Choices...So Kind and welcoming... Real consistent Food & Service... Above & Beyond Service...

We visited this place today and it was a great experience. The food was delicious , the service was excellent and they take good care of their customers. It's family owned and the feeling is very warm and friendly. They do need more tables inside because businesses is booming and is too cold to sit on the tables they have outside. I'm still giving them a 5 star review, so you can tell I loved their food.

Let me explain and tell you that as a hispanic this is the only Spanish food restaurant in Harrisburg that is worth visiting and trying and also making it a habit. There’s several restaurants out here but it doesn’t taste as good or is well cooked as this one. The employees are friendly and very passionate about what they do. 

If you have not tried this or you’re skeptical. stop what you’re doing and please enjoy the meals here.
For Spanish food, Cidra's is a must go. A mouthwatering selection of food. And the portions, wow, huge. My eyes are always bigger than my stomach. Well Done. You have me looking forward to returning.
The food is great, but it's served cafeteria style. It would be nicer if there was a menu and food was made to order. Husband loves it so I will send him here for carry out once in a blue moon.

name: Philadelphia Steaks & Hoagies
reviews: Alright cheesesteak, it was just alright. The bread from Philly was great, the meat was flavorful but a bit dry. Not enough cheese, looks cheesy but it's only on the outside, not inside of the sandwich. Fries were pretty ok, I got cheese fries and it was over kill. So ok food, but the expensive prices and tiny amounts aren't doing it any favors.

By far the best cheese steak around! I had to actually get on here and look at the "one star reviews" those are bogus!!! I love going to grab a cheese steak at lunch!! Know what you want before you get in line and there isn't much of a wait at all!! Keep up the good work guys!
Ok, so it's not in Philadelphia, but it's close enough.  Good sandwiches and quick service name this a great lunchtime stop while in Harrisburg.

Some of the best Philly Cheesesteaks outside of Philly!  This is close to the state capital, and provides some of the best mid week dining options around.  Both the traditional and chicken cheesesteaks are fantastic, although you should make sure to be prepared to order when you get to the counter.  The staff appreciates people who don't fumble about.
Great place for a quick sit down meal! First time coming here and will definitely be back again!!

name: The Cheesesteak Guy
reviews: Best cheesesteaks in all of Harrisburg!!!
Best cheeseteaks in the area. I like hamburgers better though, and their hamburgers are dangerously good. Haven't tried much else on their menu to date, but I intend to.

I swear every time I go here, I am never let down. You can't go wrong with any choice on the menu. The food is phenomenal and the employees (maybe owners) are very friendly. My only complaint is that I can't get this food 7 days out of the week!
Food was good and hot... employees are nice and professional
Farm fresh ribeye cheesesteaks and burgers, nothing else like this in the area.  Amazing!

name: note. bistro & winebar
reviews: Just dined there for the 2nd time. Tonight was the first of their Community Table events. Highly recommend. 4 courses paired with wine. Dessert was not included,  but I had it any way. Everything,  start to finish was excellent!

Went here with my friend for my birthday.
The place is small but cute.
Very romantic inside!! Great for date night!
Foods are really really good! So moist and rich in flavors. They also sell and serve alcohol too.
The red beets salad were great and the duck leg also fabulous. I got the lamb with goat cheese raviolis with spinach and mushrooms. And my friend got pork chop.
They're both very tasty.
Definitely will make a come back!

Absolutely amazing ! We drove all the way from Maryland just to come here and it was totally worth it ! If we could give it 500 stars we would ! Our server Danielle was personable, polite, prompt, attentive, and created the perfect experience for us ! The food was perfectly executed and the flavor pairings in each dish was impeccable. We WILL be back !
The bartender was a delight a mixologist,host was the best and the chef and his staff food spectacular.
If you're looking for high end food, this is the place. Perfect spot for a date night and probably the best pasta I've ever had.

name: Aleco's Café & Restaurant
reviews: We ordered a couple times now for delivery. Food was decent each time. The cheese steak has the bread you expect for an authentic taste. We'll order in future.

Unique taste,  Affordable and well maintained.

Employees are very professional and well spoken.

Very humble place to take your love ones.

Highly recommended.

They get 3 stars because the food was good (not incredible, just standard), and the price was fair. I'm taking off 2 because the restaurant was dead (only 1 other patron in there) and service was still kind of meh... and because I ordered and received water, and got charged for soda. Water is free - I'm pretty sure that's a law. I don't see how this could be an accidental mistake instead of some kind of bill padding. If you go here, be sure to check your receipt at the end.
Friendly staff, good food, good location. Went for lunch, easy to get too on N 3rd St. Everyone is very friendly there, the food is good and the prices are good. Very clean restaurant.

It was a bit tense in the kitchen during our visit as we heard some choice words come out of it. That definitely didn't give a good first impression but the food hit the spot and our server was very friendly and attentive.

name: Cafe Huey
reviews: If you are looking for somewhere with really good food and decent prices this is the place to be. Located perfectly across from the river lookout a great place to sit and have a meal with your family and friends. The staff is kind and courteous and they are quick with the orders.
Exactly what should be in this spitm. Good fresh food, drinks and ice cream

My daughter and I stopped here after we did a walk around City Island recently.  The steamed clams, cod sandwich, potato salad, and the crab cake were all  some of the best we ever ate.  The service was wonderful and Cindy is great with conversation.  When I'm in town, I plan to stop here at least once a week.  Two thumbs up!
Nice people good food. I hope one day we will see this place open year around.
Awesome food ,great selection and service

name: 2nd St Shawarma
reviews: I love shawarma. Friendly service. Good food the right price. Not expensive or too fancy. Tasted like a home cooked meal.
Loved the food! If we ever are in this part of Harrisburg again we will definitely be visiting. The staff was friendly and the restraunts was very bright and friendly.

The best fresh Mediterranean food you can get. I have traveled the country and have never had fresher falafal than I had here. The flavor beyond authentic. Great prices as well you can beat the portion size. Amazing!
Good place, and good service. The food is fresh so it's good. Wish it were just $1 dollar cheaper otherwise really good food

Food was fabulous.  Loved my falafel wrap.  My table mates were also very happy with their meals.  And the dessert of ice cream and baklava was amazing.  Very casual, not a lot of atmosphere but will definitely go again.  And I heard they are expanding:)

name: Suba Tapas
reviews: Great tapas place. Loved the tacos El pastor and the lamb pops. Fun atmosphere and helpful wait staff suggested everything we tried and loved!

This is by far my new favorite spot in Harrisburg. Tucked beside Rubicon and above Mangia lies the best tapas restaurant in Harrisburg, putting the almighty Cork and Fork at a distant second. Great Spanish wines, superb service, and delicious plates await you, but, show up early as the place is small (rustic) and it began to fill up quickly around 6p on a Saturday. Worth any wait you may have.

One of my top locations for delicious spanish food. Good place to hang and eat some good food. I had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. Bring your hunger - portions are large.

Their drinks are excellent. I really enjoyed the firefly. 
The staff is very friendly and helpful. 
The food was was absolutely delicious! 
The Suba tacos I got were amazing. The fish was nicely cooked and the mango was a nice touch.  The Monte Caballo was tasty but I felt like maybe you should get more than two for the price. They're very small but very delicious.
Excellent service at the bar with great recommendations. Food and drink excellent. Shared our plates and left pleasantly stuffed and satisfied.

name: Capow Jamaican Restaurant
reviews: Yeah man,di best Jamaican any weh round yah seen👍👍👍
The food is amazing bottom line
Great food we make that 25 minute trip
Food was terrible, rice soaked in gravy mac and cheese was rubbery as hell, i wouldn't recommend and i wouldn't go back, i had a better tasting meal at rice and beans on 17th st
Delicious food, quick, expedient service. Only issue I had is the container size a bit small for price.

name: Roxy's Cafe
reviews: Friendly place just a short walk from the Capitol.  Stopped in for a quick lunch and they have a wide selection of great food.  Food and service were great.
Delicious breakfast, fair prices. Great gathering place in historic area of Harrisburg.

A favorite place for tasty breakfast. Staff is always super even when they have a full house. I had a cousin come into town and she asked me to go back here. The prices are good for what you get. Reminds me of a cafe in Chicago I liked to visit.

The lunch menu appears unimpressive. I ended up getting a chicken salad, and was pleasantly surprised. Good quality ingredients and friendly staff. the place has that diner feel, and I would love to come back for breakfast.
Breakfast was very good and not busy at all for a Sunday morning at 10:00 am. I would highly recommend to a friend and will definitely be back.

name: Hilltop Restaurant
reviews: Good prices and great food stop in for breakfast or lunch and maybe something for dinner if you are too tired to cook
Dont let the appearance fool you the have very good food here in the coffee is brewed fresh all day  3/28/17
Love their food and they offer Turkey options for non pork fans
Great spot....... remind me of Brooklyn

We wondered around town hungry as a horse...and we came across this gas station playin music. As we look over we see 'hilltop restaurant-soul food headquarter', interesed we walk in. We were greeted with such hospitality.  We both ordered smothered pork chops..it was served over rice and beans, with two sides. I got the amazing mac and cheese and cabbage. He got collard greens and sweet potatoes. Omg! Everything was freakin awesome. The rice was cooked perfect.  The chops were fall of the bone and perfectly smothered! The sweet potatoes were mmmmm delish! We gave kudos to the cook, it was that good. The guys there were awesome...oh and to make it better, he don't add salt to his food!!! (: we got 2 (1 meat 2 sides) w 2 drinks for $12 (lunch special, an hour after it ended)..plus what we tipped um..We had left overs for reheats, too. I hands down recommend this place to anyone searching for good eats.. they also have awesome breakfast specials...well definitely be back to gice a try.

5stars!!!!!!

name: Appalachian Brewing Company
address: 50 N Cameron St, Harrisburg, PA 17101, USA
reviews: Great food menu first and foremost.  Cool place with really nice staff.  Beer isn't amazing, but it's not bad either.  The food honestly makes it worth having just an "OK" beer.  The craft sodas are actually really good as well, and if you haven't had them, they're worth trying!
Great brewery with TONS of beers on tap. There is also a wide menu list, with plenty of varied food to try. There is something for everyone! Come in for a great time. Bar staff is great!

This place is awesome! My first time visiting and I was impressed. The building is beautiful inside and out. It is comfortable and not too loud. The staff is friendly and efficient. The beer is great and the food is not only delicious and creative, its plentiful. Prices are mid range for food that is top notch. I was very impressed as was my guest. Thanks Appalachian brewing!

Outstanding food! Tonight we had the Rockfish tacos and Bourbon trail tips. Everything was great including the vegetable sides dishes. You have two choices of sauce with the tacos. One sauce was a sweet spicy honey and the other was a tomato based. However the sauce already in the tacos was superb.
The location and atmosphere are great. They might be trying too hard with the menu. Of the three plates we ordered, it seems like the burgers are the best way to go.

name: Taco Solo
reviews: The staff is wonderful. The food is awesome-Great quality, delicious, best salsas and guacamole. Great price and packaging is always perfect if you place an order for delivery. This is a gem of a restaurant. You can tell the care they put into the preparation and consistency with the items. Thank you!

All of their food is great quality. I go here all the time for a quick lunch during work. They never disappoint. Always so fresh and delicious and the staff is super friendly too! Highly recommend! 
(this is a picture of their Rice and Bean Salad)

Fantastic food and staff. Friendly and fast and always professional. I ordered today and when I picked up they were dealing with belligerent and frankly racist customers but the staff here never break their friendly and professional demeanor. I wish nothing but the best for this company and staff and will eat here often.
Best taco in downtown Harrisburg, my favourites are grill fish taco, carne asada taco, and Red Green and White (guacamole, pico, and grill shrimps w/ chips) staffs are always friendly and nice !

today I stopped at taco solo during a bicycle ride and was blown away at the service we received!  I highly recommend this place if you’re looking for amazing service to go along with their highly satisfying food! Thanks you Jorge and Angelina so much for going beyond you’re duties to accommodate us today!

name: Grilled Cheese Plus
reviews: I had the Lady with Tattoos and it was sooo good. I had it on rye bread and had my egg over easy. Yeah that's right, it came with an egg in inside that delicious grill peace of food gold. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to give it a try. It's worth the little bit of money you're going to spend here, cause the prices are very good and the lady behind the counter was really nice and  Courteous. I enjoyed it a lot.

Stopped for breakfast few minutes after 8 am on a Monday morning. As a vegetarian, it was great to see that they had a 'Create Your Own' choice on the menu. We ordered two grilled sandwiches (with veggies) along with hash brown patties. You could chose your "cheesiness" level - a nice customization for people who like their sandwich a bit cheesy!

The place has limited seating and a friendly service staff. We enjoyed our hot breakfast and will visit again. Hope they add more vegetarian options to the menu though!

Tip: Limited street parking is available right outside ($3/hr).

The food was so, so good! And even though we walked in just before closing, they were super friendly and didn't give us any Hale about ordering. I also loved the aesthetic and atmosphere!Will totally stop by again if I'm in town again!
Food was great and atmosphere was calming. Two for lunch was $21.99. I will be going back

I grabbed a late lunch here - no wait at 2pm!  I had a Huevos Rancheros breakfast sandwich on the biscuit bread option - very glad I made that choice, it was delicious.  It took a bit longer than expected for my sandwich to be ready, but when I ate it I found out why - it was cooked to perfection.  Perfectly grilled, cheese just the right amount of melted, the fried egg was over-hard just like I'd requested... YUM!  The service was very friendly and helpful.  The sitting area was clean and they have made good use of the small space - seating for 20-25 at 2 and 4 top tables.  If you are looking for a leisurely place to sit and eat, I would recommend coming outside of normal meal times to beat the rush.

name: Queen's BBQ & Southern Cuisine
reviews:
Nice employees, food is presented well, and you'll try to eat all of it because it's so good but stop yourself if you have the willpower. Otherwise you'll end up like me, in a food coma. 
Eat the ribs! 
I ordered ribs, sweet potatoes and collard greens.
All were absolutely delicious and just what I needed on a Friday of a very long week! 
💕

I expected great food and was not disappointed! They were good to tell me the wait on brisket, which was unfortunately longer than my lunch break, and instead I ordered the pulled pork with some worry... I usually don't like pork all that much. This however has made my list of good food. Delicious, juicy, and so much meat that some fell out despite my best efforts. And I WILL be coming back for that brisket!

I went in to see what the establishment was about, as I love southern food. I was pleasantly surprised not only by the food, but by the hospitality, and better yet a sign that showcased that they fed homeless and had an honor roll program for kids. It's amazing not only to have pleasant service and good food, but to see hardworking people who just started out giving back to the community! Good luck in all you do!
Had the Maryland crab soup for lunch today and it was fantastic!  Very excited to try other menu items in the future.  Keep up the great work!! :)
Great soul food selections. Just great food period! Very warm and welcome individuals, that you know care about their customers.

name: The Midtown Tavern
reviews: Such a hidden gem. The atmosphere is really laid back, but well-maintained and fun. Lots of sitting room, a nice big bar, and pool tables. Their menu has all the classics - wings, pizza, etc - with some really fun twists and unique items as well. The Dark Side of the Mustard chicken sandwich is my personal favorite! They have a great beer menu with lots of local PA nods (they also make it a point to support independeny owned breweries, which I think is awesome). 10/10 will be back!

I’ve always liked coming to Midtown (especially Taco Tuesdays!) but they recently started offering brunch. We came with a large group and half of us ordered the chicken and waffles. Without exaggeration, it was the best chicken and waffles I’ve ever had. It comes as a small sandwich and is made with a raspberry Melba sauce. The chicken was wonderfully seasoned. I’m probably going to be here every Sunday for the next month.
We were there for the Millennium music conference. Got the best table right in front of the band. The sound has always been great when I go there for live music. The service is very good as well
I had the Bacon Ranch chicken sandwich and it was delicious. The portion size was generous and the draft beer selection provided a good variety of relatively local craft beers! Service was excellent.

I only came in here for a few beers but once I do give myself a chance to eat here I will update this review but so far it is a nice cool spot to chill. I do look forward to trying out their food so until I eat here, take care and I hope this place fits your liking

name: Phyllo Greek Cuisine
reviews: It's in the Market but the whole atmosphere here is impressive. I like that the hummus is consistently fresh and flavorful. They are good and quick here.
Delicious and authentic Greek food.

Based on other reviews I acknowledge that maybe they were having an off day, but I did not enjoy my order today. I waited 20 minutes for a veggie pita and chicken souvlaki skewer. The pita was ok, nice veggie mix but no seasoning that I could catch. The whole thing was sort of blah and I didn't feel well after - like it didn't sit right. 

The chicken souvlaki was offensive. As a Greek I have high expectations and honestly if you can't make a decent souvlaki...there's just no excuse. It was bone dry, and no garlic, lemon, or oregano to speak of. I don't understand how this could go so wrong. Guys hit me up, my recipe is bomb and I will seriously give it to you!!

I'd wanted to visit this place for so long, and I was so excited. Needless to say I was incredibly disappointed.

Our favorite spot to grab lunch. Love their gyros and horiatiki with pork or chicken. The food is amazing, and the staff is friendly. The only name I can remember is Thomas, he super nice and really easy to chat with. Definitely recommend.
The Greek salad is insane!! We order it each month when we attend the 3rd in the burg.

name: Yokohama
reviews: If I could leave 0 stars, I would. I heard good things about this place so I decided to order food and have it delivered. They say they send you a confirmation e-mail after ordering. After almost 30 minutes, I hadn't received it so I called to verify that they had my order. After saying yes, the girl on the phone then hung up on me. An hour and 15 minutes later, I still had no delivery. I called again to see where my order was and POLITELY said that it had been over an hour. She god rude and proceeded to tell me that I only ordered 30 minutes prior. My call log clearly stated an hour and 14 minutes had passed. She proceeded to scream back to her kitchen (I'm guessing) and then said, it's on the way and hung up on me again. If you're looking for politeness, I'd advise you to stay away from this place. Coming from a customer service position, I strive to be unlike these individuals every single day. Oh yeah, I still haven't gotten my food yet....

I actually was not looking forward to it but I have been surprised. The General TSO chicken was amazing , great times and very great atmosphere 🙏🏾👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾. Food was nice & hot not a long wait. They play certain foods on metal dishes which keeps the food hot while your eating as well !!

I order from Yokohama online (beyondmenu app) all the time. Like several times a month, over the past probably 2+ years. From all of those orders, they only ever made ONE mistake. They had written my order down for pick up instead of delivery. Pretty minor mistake, which they immediately fixed after I called in by sending someone out to deliver it. They even tried (unprompted) to give me a discount for the wait. I gave the full amount + tip, and I'm pretty sure this just confused them.

Sorry, but I'm not sorry. Here's the thing: I appreciate what they do and I love their food. I don't think any less of them and I will continue to order regularly. They've never messed up the food in my orders (kind of unheard of in this industry) and the attention to detail in packing everything for travel is impressive. Perhaps most important: everything is delicious!
