If you haven't tried Yokohama yet, why not?? And if you have, but they happened to make a mistake, why not try them again? That might've been the only mistake they make for you for 2+ years.

Everything is "OH SO FRESH"! So we wanted to have Asian cuisine for Valentine's day. The first place we went to was overly packed and highly disorganized. The second place we tried making a reservation only to have then tell us they have to push it back an hour and a half. We got to our car, did one last search to try and find something locally and Yokohama popped up in the search bar 4 min away from where we were at. We got there and there was just 1 other couple in there so I was a bit sketched at first. But once I started trying the appetizers and random pieces of sushi or shisimi the taste was probably the freshest I've experienced since I started eating these delicacies. Will definitely go back again and will probably not go anywhere else just based off of the QUALITY of their food. Plus their wasabi is DA BOMB!! THANK FOR A GREAT TIME YOKOHAMA!! BE BACK SOON!

You'd never know this was here, just riding by, it looks vacant. The food is ALWAYS fresh. Service isn't super fast, but I've had slower, so I don't mind. I took my kids (6 and 8 years old) but there's no kids menu. They split a hibachi chicken entree. The Thai iced tea reminds me of bubble tea(A MUST HAVE) and the appetizer was piping hot. Arrived around 5:35 on a Friday and we were the only patrons dining in. By 6:15 the place was half filled. In a nutshell, this place is a gem, for sure!

name: Federal Taphouse
reviews: This bar is awesome. They have over 100 beers on tap and great food too. I highly recommend the bison burger and poutine fries. The bartender was very knowledgeable and gave me a great sour beer recommendation. If you're in the area I highly suggest checking out this place.
Excellent wood fired pizza.  The pepperoni has a superior taste.  I highly recommend.  I will say the personal pizza is large enough to split.  It is a nice size.
First time here and it was quiet at the time. 100 beers on tap! Bartender was very helpful in choosing a beer that's close to what I normally like. Cannot wait to go back and try different drinks!

The service is always nice. The only thing that I dislike is that the food is way too pricey for the quality you get. They're also hardly ever busy, so it's a good place for a large group, but not if you're looking for a high-energy bar.
Chris was a phenomenal server and made sure I was taken care of. I had the fig and pig pizza. It was savory and full of flavor. First time here and I plan to come back to explore the menu further!

name: Quigley Restaurant & Tavern
address: 1517 S Cameron St, Harrisburg, PA 17104, USA
reviews: Friendly atmosphere!!😊
Great little dive bar. Food is great. Their wings are the best around. The beer is cold and served in a chilled mug. Prices are fair. And love my bar goddess Kellen.
Nice comfortable place
Awesome hometown bar with cold beer and awesome wings!

If I could give zero stars I would. We just order lunch to go from here. I ordered a turkey club. It came on a sub roll and the turkey looked like rotting flesh. Rubber sub sandwich going directly in the trash! I couldn’t even bring myself to take in bite!!

name: Mariama's African and Jamaican Restaurant
reviews: The food is GREAT here. My favorite dish would have to be the oxtails and rice n beans. The food portions are HUGE. I usually divide 3 portions from just one plate.

I’m a vegetarian and I ordered their rice and beans with cabbage and onions on top- best decision I’ve ever made! Nothing better. Friendly service and great prices. Get the hot sauce and coco bread, and you’ll have the best meal ever.

The reviews on this Restaurant are hilarious! The owners are all African! There will be cultural differences, be respectful. The Restaurant is seat yourself, and there is an African family vibe that I love. 

Also, this Restaurant  mostly caters to west African foods. Wouldn't recommend the Jamaican foods bc the cooks are from Niger. Great west African soups!

Americans- go for the meat pies! : )
Authentic and home made food. It was a great restaurant for some very different food than we are used to eating. Great prices and service!

Was traveling from up state PA to Philly...Greyhound overlay in Harrisburg so decided to find some close good grub, found a gem. Good blend of African and Jamaican food. I got the Curry Chicken, but it smelled like African food..it was kind both, was good though!

name: Soul House Cafe
reviews: Do not be fooled by this rough exterior, the food is to die for!! Full of the right flavors, made with love you can taste. The cake is amazing (lemon is my favorite).  The catfish is crispy and tender at the same time (without being slimy inside the batter) and the everything wings are a must try!!
I STOP BY TODAY SURE GLAD I DID IT WAS ONE OF THE BEST CHEESEBURGER SUB I EVER TASTED 5/25/17

twice a year, i get to eat anything i want. i love this place.  prices are good. since i found it, i always order fried fish, mac/cheese, greens or cabbage.  love the fish and cornbread every time.  a few weeks ago, cabbage was bland; the mac/cheese was just boiled mac w cheese on top.  disappointed to say the least. since we have to buy whole dinners, be consistent w your sides. i gave 5 stars cause the food is almost always perfect. for 1 who only gets to eat soul twice a year, i need satisfaction both times.
Good Soulfood! This was my first visit but not the last.  The food was Hot, fresh, and delicious.  Because I'm from Florida I know good soul food and this was Good.

The food was very good. I loved the collard greens, baked beans, mac n cheese, wings, shrimp. It was all so good. We are from the south and its hard finding a place that has good southern foods. We will be back

name: Emerald
reviews: Well I move here to Harrisburg 2 years ago and I never could find a good Chinese food so my sis told my wife about this place so just 20 minutes for the first time I try it and I have to give u  a 5 stars because the ladies was nice the food is amazing keep up the good work
Favorite Spot... Fried Chicken, cheese fries, shrimp egg foo young, Shrimp Chow mein allll of that is on point.

Grew up a couple blocks from this spot and it’s always been a gem. Not much for atmosphere inside there lol 😂 but the food is always tasty and they hook you up with good portions too. Known for chicken wings and General tso’s.

Lived in Harrisburg for 8 years before coming here. What have I been doing with my life!?

I think this may be one of those places that remains a well kept local secret. Lots of foot traffic on a Thursday night.

Service was friendly and prompt, food was cheap and fresh. I’d recommend this to anyone looking for some fairly cheap and very delicious take out. 

I recommend the bean curd in house sauce, you could easily feed 2 with it on the cheap. General Tso’s chicken is also plenty good. Be forewarned they want $8+ to use a credit card.

The atmosphere of this restaurant was, bad to say the least. The food however was great! Get to this restaurant on busy days and you won't regret it because there is a lot of fresh food and for $8 not much else to say other than it looks to have a lot of parking and it is quick, looks be in a shady part of town but don't be intimidated it's a good restaurant at heart.

name: Ted's Bar & Grill Midtown
reviews: Very nice staff! The wings were ultra yummy and the fries were perfect!! Good food to veg out and watch a movie 😁

It took a while to get to place an order but once order was placed food came out very fast. Chicken gyro was very good, fresh cut fries are good as well. Their wing sauces are very unique and good. Beer was a little pricey, a draft of Dirt Wolf IPA was $7.

Good food with what appeared to be an updated menu since the last time I was there. The fish sandwich was hand battered and tasted great. Very good and the cream of crab was excellent as well. The food and prices are worth it.
A favorite hangout with a view of the river. Great beer selection and great food. A really fun place the the deck has the doors up.

Food was great! I had the Crown burger and she had a Rueben, both looked great and tasted better. Also tried the Maryland Crab soup and it was also great! Typical sports bar scene that had plenty of TVs with all the games playing. Had a view of at least 3 games from my seat and could see 2 more if I looked around. The service was a bit slow but they were packed full so that's to be expected. The staff was friendly and very personable, did not feel neglected even tho they were very busy. We will be back next time we're in midtown for anything.

name: Flamingo Grill
reviews: The best pancakes I ever had came from right here at Flamingo. Great food and atmosphere.
Great cheap breakfast.
Good food.. great people.
Great food and staff I will be back when in the area
Meal wasn't that good, but it was a nice chill spot to read and eat.

name: El Rancho Restaurante y Pupuseria
reviews:
AUTHENTIC & DELICIOUS QUALITY FOOD! 
So sad I couldn’t get a picture of my entree. Deserts are made to order and from SCRATCH!! You can see them cooking your food. The place is very clean, kid friendly and friendly staff. The food was PERFECT! Fresh, flavorful and good amounts. This place is a 10 STAR! The best is PA for sure!!!

Ok to start I want to tell you that this place is a gem. The staff is super friendly, ask for Ana she is super nice and attends so nice, you won't be disappoint. Those who work in the kitchen they have a special hand for cooking. The truth is that I recommend this place, to eat,hangouts and have a good time, they will make you feel welcome and treat you like family. And I travel from Lancaster which are about 45 minutes and it's really worth it. Authentic Mexican cuisine with a lot of flavor.

Listen, guys. I NEVER write any reviews, but tonight I feel like I have to. This food is absolutely AMAZING! Tastes like authentic home cooked food, unbelievable. My husband and I are very impressed. Great way to celebrate Cinco da Mayo! Ordering again soon, for sure!!

I was very impressed with El Rancho. Me and the wife decided to come in on a sunday afternoon when half the restaurants in Downtown Harrisburg are closed. I had some tacos and she had a taco salad. The flavors of everything were top notch. I hope this places gets more business because it definitely hit the mark for us.

I wanted tacos, so we came into Harrisburg on a Saturday afternoon and none of the other restaurants opened until 4:00 p.m. We found that this place was open and fit the bill for my taco craving. It was delicious and fast!
